channel.title: The Harrington
channel.description: High finished serviced residences for both long and short term let

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens offers the following services to all of our guests:

  • 24 Hour Reception and Concierge
  • Air Conditioning
  • Airport transfers (charged)
  • Breakfast Vouchers (charged)
  • Central Heating
  • Communal Washing and drying facility
  • Daily Housekeeping
  • En Suite Bathroom
  • Flat screen TV
  • Hair Dryer
  • In Room Safe
  • Iron and Ironing Board
  • Laundry and Dry Cleaning service (charged)
  • Linen and Towels
  • Luggage storage
  • Regular towel and linen change
  • Satellite channels
  • Wake Up Service
  • Wireless Broadband (Free)

Set in chic South Kensington, just 2 minutes’ walk from Gloucester Road station and with many shops and a wide variety of restaurants in the immediate vicinity, The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens is a collection of spacious serviced apartments including Studio Apartments, One Bedroom Apartments and Two Bedroom Apartments.

Designed and furnished in a contemporary style, your serviced apartment provides much more space and many more facilities than a London hotel room at excellent value in one of the best central London locations.  Travel direct to other parts of central London as well as from London Heathrow and from the Gatwick Express at Victoria Station.  Most of London’s main museums, the Royal Albert Hall, Kensington Gardens, Hyde Park and exclusive shopping in Knightsbridge are all within walking distance.

Your apartment is air conditioned and has a comfortable lounge and dining area, a well equipped kitchen or kitchenette and has flat screen TV with satellite channels and newly boosted free Wifi.  Make The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens your London address.

[caption id="attachment_64" align="alignnone" width="150"] 1 Harrington Gardens[/caption]

 

[caption id="attachment_68" align="alignnone" width="150"] Corridor[/caption]

 

[caption id="attachment_54" align="alignnone" width="150"] Lounge[/caption]

An excellent choice for a moderate stay for a single person or couple, all apartments offer:

  • 24 Hour Reception and Concierge
  • Air Conditioning
  • Airport transfers (charged)
  • Breakfast Vouchers (charged)
  • Central Heating
  • Communal Washing and drying facility
  • Daily Housekeeping
  • En Suite bathroom
  • Flat screen TV
  • Hair Dryer
  • In Room Safe
  • Iron and Ironing Board
  • Laundry and Dry Cleaning service (charged)
  • Linen and Towels
  • Luggage storage
  • Regular towel and linen change
  • Satellite channels
  • Wake Up Service
  • Wireless Broadband (Free)

Choose your preference of our standard or Large Studio Apartments.  These have the same facilities although the Large Studio Apartment is more spacious and generally has a separate kitchen, whilst the standard Studio Apartment has a kitchenette incorporated in the lounge and dining area.  Apartments have a double or king size bed and are rear-facing, with the exception of the small number of apartments on the Lower Ground Floor.  A small number of Large Studio Apartments have the option of inter-connecting with a similar number of One Bedroom Apartments to make a really spacious combination.

[caption id="attachment_60" align="alignnone" width="150"] Bathroom[/caption]

 

[caption id="attachment_56" align="alignnone" width="150"] Kitchen[/caption]

 

[caption id="attachment_61" align="alignnone" width="150"] Bedroom[/caption]

An excellent choice for a moderate stay for a single person or couple, all apartments offer:

  • 24 Hour Reception and Concierge
  • Air Conditioning
  • Airport transfers (charged)
  • Breakfast Vouchers (charged)
  • Central Heating
  • Communal Washing and drying facility
  • Daily Housekeeping
  • En Suite bathroom
  • Flat screen TV
  • Hair Dryer
  • In Room Safe
  • Iron and Ironing Board
  • Laundry and Dry Cleaning service (charged)
  • Linen and Towels
  • Luggage storage
  • Regular towel and linen change
  • Satellite channels
  • Wake Up Service
  • Wireless Broadband (Free)

One Bedroom Apartments are noticeably larger than studio Apartments and offer the privacy of a separate bedroom from the Lounge.  One Bedroom Apartments are front, side and rear facing and vary in shape and layout with an overall size of 40 – 45 square meters, whilst our very popular Deluxe One Bedroom Apartments are noticeably larger at 54 square meters.  Both types of One Bedroom Apartment have a very well equipped kitchen, with crockery, cutlery, glass and cookware provided.  One bedroom Apartments can fit an extra rollaway bed, when needed, to accommodate a small family but are equally perfect for a couple or single guests.  All apartments offer:

[caption id="attachment_69" align="alignnone" width="150"] Kitchen[/caption]

 

[caption id="attachment_54" align="alignnone" width="150"] Lounge[/caption]

 

[caption id="attachment_59" align="alignnone" width="150"] Bedroom[/caption]

 

[caption id="attachment_53" align="alignnone" width="150"] Bathroom[/caption]

An excellent choice for a moderate stay for a single person or couple, all apartments offer:

  • 24 Hour Reception and Concierge
  • Air Conditioning
  • Airport transfers (charged)
  • Breakfast Vouchers (charged)
  • Central Heating
  • Communal Washing and drying facility
  • Daily Housekeeping
  • En Suite bathroom
  • Flat screen TV
  • Hair Dryer
  • In Room Safe
  • Iron and Ironing Board
  • Laundry and Dry Cleaning service (charged)
  • Linen and Towels
  • Luggage storage
  • Regular towel and linen change
  • Satellite channels
  • Wake Up Service
  • Wireless Broadband (Free)

With only 5 Two Bedroom Apartments in the building, these are one of our most sought after apartment types.  Always side facing (overlooking Gloucester Road) these apartments normally have a king size bed in the master bedroom and twin beds in the second bedroom.  In some cases, the twin beds can alternatively be configured as a second king size.  There are two bathrooms – on en suite to the master bedroom and one of the hallway of the apartment.  Excellent value for a family or two couples travelling together, these apartments can fit an extra rollaway bed, when needed, to accommodate a fifth guest

• Studio apartment
  • 1 bathroom
  • 300 sq. ft.
  • £550 per week for 6 months+ let only
  • £800 per week for 6 months+ let (including services below)
  • £1,400 per week for 1-6month let (including services below)
  • Wide screen TVs
  • DVDs, Amplifiers
  • Apple Airplay & speakers in all rooms
  • Apple TV
  • Fully fitted Kitchen & Siemens appliances
  • White Bone China and LHA crystal glassware
  • Video Entry
  • 24hr CCTV
  • In room safe

Optional included services

  • Daily Maid service including basic toiletries
  • Broadband Internet
  • TV licence
  • Council tax bills
  • Gas & Electricity bills
  • Water bills

This studio apartment has been thoughtfully refurbished in order to restore original features whilst providing contemporary living.

The apartment is finished to high specifications using multi-room audio-visual systems, fully integrated kitchens, underfloor heating, American white oak hard floors throughout and CCTV.

Harrington Gardens is walking distance to Gloucester Road underground station, as well as all the shops, restaurants and amenities of South Kensington

A development with modern, contemporary styled apartments set within a renovated period building on this quiet tree lined street in South Kensington. The building has eighteen apartments.

All apartments include, wide screen TVs, BluRay players, amplifiers, Apple TV, Apple Airplay & speakers, 100mb broadband, wifi router in every room, fully integrated designer kitchens with Siemens Appliance, white bone china, LHA crystal glassware, video entry, in room safes, ample storage, select American white oak floors, and CCTV through out.

Lucie Clayton House, used to be a famous finishing school. In the 60′s it successfully added a modelling school with pupils such as Joanna Lumley and Sandra Paul. Lucie Clayton House has been refurbished in a classic modern style, with restored cornicing, arched doors, grand fireplaces, balustrades into 6 luxury apartments, which maintain the building’s natural sense of space. The glass lift provides a natural lightwell. The property is filled with technology such as LCD TV’s in the bathrooms, electric curtains, CCTV, full AV systems.

A new development with modern, contemporary styled apartments set within a renovated period building on this quiet tree lined street in South Kensington. The building is south facing, situated opposite St Stephens Church which provides beautiful views from the apartments. The building has six apartments and a stunning 3 bedroom maisonette with a large private south facing terrace.

All apartments include, wide screen TVs, BluRay players, amplifiers, Apple TV, Apple Airplay & speakers, 50mb broadband, wifi router in every room, fully integrated designer kitchens with Siemens Appliance, white bone china, LHA crystal glassware, video entry, in room safes, ample storage, select American white oak floors, and CCTV through out.

Southwell Gardens is walking distance to Gloucester Road Underground Station, as well as all the local shops, restaurants and amenities of South Kensington..

item.title: Serviced Apartments at The Harrington
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[tabs]
[thead]
[tab class="active" type="tab" href="#dws_first_tab26" title="The Harrington"]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab139876169319926" title="Clients"]
[/thead][tcontents]
[tcontent class="active" id="dws_first_tab26"]

The Harrington offers forty luxury serviced apartments and forty exclusive serviced residences for short and long term let.

Cradled in the heart of Kensington and Chelsea, London, only a short walk away from Gloucester Road tube station this extremely desirable area provides access to some of the best amenities, entertainment and events in Central London.

We offer a range of facilities such as Wi-Fi, air conditioning, in-room safety deposit boxes and 24 Hour Reception and Concierge, ensuring that all essential requirements are taken care of at The Harrington - Serviced Apartments.

[button size="normal" type="default" value="Book your stay with us..." href="http://localhost/v2.theharrington.combook-now"]

[/tcontent]
[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139876169319926"]

Our Exclusive Clients

With enough space to unwind, entertain and feel at home, The Harrington makes you to feel like you are really living. Its your home-away-from-home and our clients agree.

...And many more large cap companies

[/tcontent]
[/tcontents]
[/tabs]

item.title: Prana Wellbeing
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Welcome to Prana Wellbeing.

Prana in Sanskrit means ‘universal life force'

Prana Wellbeing provides proactive healthcare through the following services:

  • Prana Pilates
  • Prana Physiotherapy
  • Prana Nordic Walking
  • Prana Yoga
  • Prana Personal Training
  • Prana Nutrition

Soon we will take referrals from medical insurance companies who recognise the importance of proactive well-being.  We work closely with Medicare Francais, next door, who provide Osteopathy, Cranial Osteopathy, Chiropractic, Dental, Orthodontics, GP and Radiography.

We look forward to meeting you soon.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Prana Wellbeing - Pilates, Physio, Yoga, Training, Nutrition and Nordic Walking
Prana Wellbeing Services include: pilates, physio, nordic walking, yoga, personal training and nutrition. We are in Kensington near Gloucester Road Tube.

item.title: Terms And Conditions
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
These conditions govern all bookings made with Fin-Ex Property No.4 (UK) Limited t/a The Harrington (“Fin-Ex”, “The Harrington”, “us”, “we”) registered in England under number 08551206 whose registered office is at 52 Grosvenor Gardens, London SW1W 0AU.

You (“you”, “the booker” , “ and all members of your party collectively called “the guests“) accept these conditions yourself and on behalf of all members of your party whether you are booking as a guest or on behalf of others. In addition by visiting or using our website you agree to comply with the Site Terms.

In respect of all bookings relating to apartments not operated by us, we act as an introductory agent on behalf of our preferred suppliers. Your contract for such bookings will be with the actual preferred supplier. All such bookings will be also subject to the relevant preferred supplier’s conditions. You will be notified at the time of booking if further preferred supplier conditions also apply.

[collapse id="collapse_62"]
[citem title="1.2 Special Requests" id="citem_12" parent="collapse_62"]
We will endeavour to do everything we can to help guests with special requirements. Please ensure we are made aware in writing, of any special requirements at time of booking so we can help you select the most suitable apartment for your needs. Although we will endeavour to meet any reasonable requests no guarantees can be given that any request will be met. Conditional bookings cannot be accepted i.e. any booking which is specified to be conditional on the fulfilment of a particular request. Access Statements are available for all Fin-Ex properties; please ask us for a copy if required.
[/citem]

[citem title="1.3 Group Bookings" id="citem_13" parent="collapse_62"]
We consider a group to be three apartments or more being booked in the same city for similar dates. Special conditions may apply and these will be advised at the time of booking. Cancellation charges may differ to those in clause Cl.4.5 and will be advised at the time of booking.
[/citem]

[citem title="2.1 Payment" id="citem_21" parent="collapse_62"]
Payment in full is required at the time of booking unless otherwise agreed. If payment does not reach us at the required time we reserve the right to suspend or cancel any booking made. Any late payments will result in interest being charged at 4% above Bank of England base rate for the period concerned.

Payment should be made in Pounds Sterling or Euro by:

Credit or Debit card. A transaction fee of 3.25% on the total payable will apply to Diners Club and American Express Card (Amex) and 1.75% to Visa Credit Card and MasterCard payments. There is no transaction fee on Visa Debit Card or Maestro/ Solo payments. Credit card details must match the security checks. We may pass your debit/credit card details to a third party to process any payments. Credit card fees are not refundable in any circumstances.

Company Cheque: payable to ‘Fin-Ex – The Serviced Apartment Company Limited’.

Bank Transfer: (bank details are available on request).
[/citem]

[citem title="2.2 Security Deposit" id="citem_22" parent="collapse_62"]
A Security Deposit to cover “additional charges “ ( see cl.12), including breakages, damages, extra cleaning and further accommodation charges incurred during your stay, may be taken and you will be advised whether this is payable at the time of booking or on arrival at the apartment.
[/citem]

[citem title="2.3 Payment of Additional Charges" id="citem_23" parent="collapse_62"]
Valid credit/debit card details must be supplied at the time of booking and/or upon arrival at the apartments to cover “additional charges “(see cl.12.). These may be payable direct to the preferred supplier in some instances.

These charges will be deducted from any Security Deposit held or from a debit/credit card supplied and any balance on the security deposit will be refunded. A written statement of the “additional charges” will be sent to you. In the event that payment under a debit/credit card is declined, or no card details are provided, we reserve the right to invoice the booker or guest direct for these charges.
[/citem]

[citem title="3.1 Pricing" id="citem_31" parent="collapse_62"]
The rates we advertise are to the best of our knowledge correct at the date of publication but we reserve the right to change any rates from time to time. Prior to the booking being confirmed rates quoted are based on the rates prevailing at the time but are subject to change. Once a booking has been confirmed we will not change the rate quoted unless you amend the booking or our cost of supplying the accommodation changes as a result of tax changes or currency fluctuations beyond our control. VAT is charged at the rate in force at the time of booking.
[/citem]

[citem title="4.1 Changes, Extensions and Cancellations" id="citem_41" parent="collapse_62"]
All requests for changes, extensions and cancellations must be made in writing directly to us. (Accordingly, if your booking is not changed, extended or cancelled through us you will be liable to pay us the full amount of the booking.)
[/citem]

[citem title="4.2 Changes" id="citem_42" parent="collapse_62"]
If you wish to change any detail of your confirmed booking we will do our best to make the change subject to an administration fee of £30 plus VAT per booking which will be payable to us once any change has been made together with any other resulting costs which may result in an increase or decrease in rate depending on the date and length of stay. Changes to the arrival date to later than the original date confirmed will be treated as a cancellation under Clause 4.4 and 4.5 below.

All changes of date are subject to availability. Should any change be rejected, the original booking will be re-instated. Name changes or child age changes will not incur any charges or administration fee.
[/citem]

[citem title="4.3 Extensions" id="citem_43" parent="collapse_62"]
If you wish to extend a stay please give us as much notice as possible in order to facilitate your request. All extensions are subject to availability and rate change.

Where notice to extend a stay has been given, we reserve the right to take all additional payments and charges from any credit/debit card used to make the original booking, or an invoice for the extended period will be sent to your billing address and payment must be made by return.
[/citem]

[citem title="4.4 Cancellations" id="citem_44" parent="collapse_62"]
Our cancellation policy is set out below; however, where we act as agent for a preferred supplier their cancellation policy may differ from our own. The specific cancellation policy should be requested at the time of booking and will be stated on the confirmation.

Fin-Ex reserves the right to treat an early departure or reduction in the number of nights or apartments booked as a cancellation and apartments may be re- let and cancellation charges will apply. Non-arrivals will be treated as a cancellation and you will not be entitled to any refunds.

Please note that transaction fees are not refundable in the event of a cancellation.
[/citem]

[citem title="4.5 Notice Period" id="citem_45" parent="collapse_62"]
Cancellation charges relate to the date prior to arrival when we are notified of the cancellation and will determine the cancellation charges incurred according to the scale below.

These notice periods also apply to early departure, postponed arrival or reduction in the number of minimum nights stay. For group bookings the minimum notice period and the cancellation charge per apartment, regardless of length of stay, is the same as for stays of 28 + nights (see below).

LENGTH OF STAY NOTICE PERIOD CANCELLATION CHARGE

1 – 6 nights 7 days prior to arrival date No refund

7 + nights 7 days prior to arrival date Minimum 7 nights’ accommodation

28 + nights 28 days prior to arrival date Minimum 7 nights’ accommodation
[/citem]

[citem title="5.1 Changes by Us" id="citem_51" parent="collapse_62"]
We do not expect to have to make any changes to your booking however occasionally bookings have to be changed or cancelled or errors in information or other details corrected and we reserve the right to do so. If this does happen, we will contact you by telephone or email where reasonably possible. If a change has to be made or your booking has to be cancelled we will, if possible, offer you an alternative apartment of similar type and standard in a similar location for the same period. If the alternative apartment is advertised at a lower price, you will receive a refund of the price difference. However if the alternative apartment is at a higher price the new price will be payable. If you do not wish to accept a change or any alternative apartment offered or we cannot offer you a suitable alternative apartment, you may be entitled to cancel your booking and receive a refund unless this is the result of an Event beyond our Control – see below. You should tell us as soon as possible whether you wish to accept any change or alternative apartment offered or alternatively if you want a refund.

Events beyond our Control include but are not limited to the following: act of God, outbreak of hostilities, riot, civil disturbance, acts of terrorism, revolution, the act of any government or authority (including but not limited to refusal or revocation of any licence or consent), fire, flood, lightning, explosion, fog or bad weather, epidemic, interruption or failure of a utility service (including but not limited to electricity, gas, water or telecommunications), renovations and building work undertaken at the property or in the local area, strikes, lockouts or boycotts, embargo, blockade.
[/citem]

[citem title="6.1 Insurance" id="citem_61" parent="collapse_62"]
We are not responsible for the theft and/or damage of your personal belongings during your stay in any apartment booked. Therefore you are advised to ensure you have appropriate insurances in place. In addition you are advised to ensure you have appropriate travel insurance to cover cancellation and medical expenses.
[/citem]

[citem title="7.1 Website" id="citem_71" parent="collapse_62"]
Reasonable care has been taken to ensure that the content of our website (and/or other means of promotion or advertising) is correct but it is subject to amendment at any time without notice.

All content on our website (and/or other means of promotion or advertising) is published in good faith but you acknowledge that we cannot check the accuracy of all information provided by our preferred suppliers for whom we act as agent.

Given the above factors, we do not warrant that any of the content on our website (and/or other means of promotion or advertising) accurately or completely describes any of the apartments. Our website may link to other websites and we are not responsible for the data policies, content or security of these linked websites.

Our website (and/or other means of promotion or advertising) will only have a general representation of the accommodation shown. Actual apartment size, design, fixtures, furnishings and facilities may vary.
[/citem]

[citem title="8.1 Liability" id="citem_81" parent="collapse_62"]
We are responsible for our own operated apartments, subject to these conditions. We act as agent for our preferred suppliers and, other than our general management and booking obligations detailed in these conditions, we shall not be liable to any party for any amounts in relation to any acts or omissions or any damage or problem arising under or in relation to that contract with the relevant preferred supplier.

All warranties, conditions and other terms implied by statute or common law or otherwise are, to the fullest extent permitted by law, excluded from any contract with us and these conditions shall apply in their place.

However, nothing in these terms and conditions shall affect your statutory rights if you are a consumer. Nothing in these terms and conditions limits or excludes our liability for death or personal injury resulting from negligence; or for any damage or liability incurred by you as a result of fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation by us, or any liability that cannot by law be excluded.

Subject to the paragraph above, we shall not be liable for any loss of profits, loss of business, depletion of goodwill and/or similar losses, loss of anticipated savings, loss of goods, loss of contract, loss of use, loss of corruption of data or information, or any special, indirect, consequential or pure economic loss, costs, damages, charges or expenses.

If you are booking for, as or on behalf of a business or business employee, that business shall indemnify us against all liabilities, costs, expenses, damages and losses (including any direct or indirect consequential losses, loss of profit, loss of reputation and all interest, penalties and legal and other reasonable professional costs and expenses) suffered or incurred by us arising out of or in connection with your, or your business’s, breach or negligent performance or non-performance of these terms and conditions.

If you are booking for, as, or on behalf of a business or business employee, our total liability in contract, tort (including negligence or breach of statutory duty), misrepresentation, restitution or otherwise arising in connection with the performance or contemplated performance of your booking shall be limited to the fees paid to us under your booking.

Other than in relation to death or personal injury caused by our negligence, or any other liability that by law cannot be excluded or restricted, our liability to you in relation to these conditions is limited to the higher of (i) GBP £1,000; and (ii) the value of the booking made with us.
[/citem]

[citem title="9.1 Your Accommodation" id="citem_91" parent="collapse_62"]
All apartments are occupied as serviced apartments and are only to be used as temporary or holiday accommodation for you, or your organisation. They are not for use as the principal, additional home or residence of guests; you will not be entitled to a tenancy or an assured shorthold or assured tenancy.

No relationship of landlord and tenant is created and no statutory security of tenure exists now or when the period of occupation ends. If you or any member of your party fails to vacate at the end of the period you will be charged the appropriate accommodation charges for the continued period of occupation. No persons other than the guests have the right to use the apartment.

These conditions constitute an excluded agreement under S(3A)(7)(a)of the Protection from Eviction Act 1977 (as amended) and cannot be construed as an assured tenancy under the Housing Act 1988 (as amended).

We cannot guarantee an exact apartment number prior to arrival.

The maximum guests in an apartment is determined by the number of beds in the apartment. If the maximum number is exceeded then we, or the preferred supplier, may refuse access to the accommodation and/or reserve the right to charge for additional apartments.
[/citem]

[citem title="9.2 Arriving and Departing" id="citem_92" parent="collapse_62"]
Apartments are available from 4pm on the day of arrival to 11am on the day of departure. Early arrival or late departure may be available for an additional charge but cannot be guaranteed unless booked from the night before arrival or for the night after departure.
[/citem]

[citem title="9.3 Access to Your Apartment" id="citem_93" parent="collapse_62"]
Key collection details will be provided to you (via your booker where applicable) prior to arrival. Many apartments do not have reception desks and you will be given a code to enter the building and details of key collection once your booking is confirmed. It is essential that you have this information with you on arrival and, where notified, contact us in advance to confirm the arrival procedure.
[/citem]

[citem title="9.4 Departure" id="citem_94" parent="collapse_62"]
The procedure for departure will be confirmed on arrival.
[/citem]

[citem title="10.1 Facilities and Services" id="citem_101" parent="collapse_62"]
The following information applies to Fin-Ex operated apartments but will vary at preferred supplier apartments. Further information is available on our website, from our reservations team or on arrival.

Cleaning: Your apartment is cleaned weekly. The day your cleaning is scheduled will be advised on arrival. Weekly housekeeping includes linen/towel change and general cleaning.

Maintenance: Routine maintenance is carried out regularly by our Management team; however, occasionally we may need access to your apartment to carry out essential maintenance. We will normally give you 24hours notice except in the event of an emergency when we require immediate access.

Telephone: Where telephones are provided in apartments guests are responsible for all call charges incurred during their stay. In some cases the call charges are provided by a third party supplier and guests are responsible for setting up an account with the provider direct. Where applicable, information is provided in the Guest Information Folder in the apartment.

Internet Access: Where access is available in apartments, it may be charged for separately. Information about Internet access will be provided at time of booking and on arrival. Access is subject to the Fin-Ex acceptable use policy which in the interest of fairness and to ensure the best service for all guests limits the data download to a maximum limit of 1GB (1024MB) per day. If this limit is exceeded Fin-Ex reserves the right to impose a charge for excess use see Clause 12.1 Additional Charges.
At peak times the bandwidth available for connection to the Internet may be under pressure due to the number of people connecting to the Internet, both internally and externally. Fin-Ex recommends that activities requiring increased bandwidth such as Skype, Movie/TV streaming is limited at these times. A support service is available to assist guests connecting to the Internet but if in Fin-Ex’s opinion the fault is deemed to be with the guest’s equipment no support can be provided. Guests must not interfere, move or disconnect any equipment relating to the provision of the Internet access and must not use the connection for any illegal or immoral purpose (including but not limited to file sharing) and Fin-Ex reserve the right to pass on any record to the authorities should Fin-Ex be made aware of any such use. Fin-Ex reserves the right to disconnect a guest at any time without notice if, in Fin-Ex’s opinion they breach any of these terms and conditions (including exceeding the download limit) or fail to pay for the connection at the agreed rate.

Security: Guests will be provided with a set of keys/fobs/access card to access the property and the apartment. Additional sets can be provided on request. It is your responsibility to ensure you are in possession of these at all times and that they are returned at the end of your stay. An additional charge will be made for replacements and if we are required to provide access due to lost or forgotten keys.

Interruption to services: We will make every effort to ensure that guests enjoy a peaceful stay, however, cannot guarantee or be held responsible for any failure or interruption of services to the apartment or the building, including electricity, air conditioning, water or any damage to telephone, broadband/ internet and other communications, including disruption or noise caused as a result of repair works being carried out in another part of the property. Where we are made aware of such failure or interruption we will endeavour to rectify such services within a reasonable period of time at our apartments, and will use reasonable endeavours to ensure any preferred supplier is made aware of, and rectifies, such problems within a reasonable period.

Management Services: Our Management team is available to ensure your stay is as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. Contact details and working hours are made available on arrival.
[/citem]

[citem title="11.1 Guest Responsibility" id="citem_111" parent="collapse_62"]
Guests are expected to comply with any regulations for use of the apartment. These are available on arrival usually in the Guest Information Folder, in the apartment. If any guest breaches any of these conditions or the regulations, we reserve the right to request a guest vacate their apartment immediately without refund.

Smoking: Smoking is not permitted in any apartment or apartment building.

Pets: Pets are not allowed in any apartment or apartment building.

Nuisance: Guests are required to behave in a responsible manner, respect the apartment and their fellow guests and keep noise to a minimum between the hours of 10pm and 7am. This includes causing any sort of nuisance or disruption to fellow guests or using threatening or abusive behaviour towards a member of staff on the phone, in writing or in person. Guests are not permitted to use the apartment for any illegal or immoral purposes. An additional charge will be made if the Management team is called out in response to a nuisance complaint.

Age Restrictions: In order to ensure our guests enjoy a stay free from disturbance, at Fin-Ex operated apartments, non-corporate bookings may not be accepted from any paying guests under the age of 25. Proof of identification and date of birth may be requested on arrival and if not presented on request, we reserve the right to cancel the booking.

Visitors: Guests are responsible for their visitors. Non residents will not be allowed access to the apartments after 11pm and we operate a strict no party policy.

Damage: Guests are required to keep the apartment, furniture, fittings and effects in the same condition as on arrival. Inventories and condition reports can be provided at the start and end of the stay, if required, at an additional cost. You are required to notify us of any damage, loss or broken items or matters requiring general maintenance. Any damage to the apartment will be charged in full. In the event that these are discovered after departure we will notify you or the booker within 7 days of departure with full details and where possible photographic evidence.

Cleanliness: We expect the apartments to be left in a reasonable state of cleanliness and order on departure. An additional charge will be made for extra cleaning or specialist cleaning to return the apartment to a fit state for occupation. Additional charges may include compensation for loss of revenue in addition to cleaning and repairs.

Lost Property: All your possessions should be removed from the apartment on the date of departure. We will use reasonable endeavours to retain any lost items for up to 3 months after your departure date.

Email: reservations@theharrington.com for enquiries relating to lost items.

Storage: Where facilities are available and at the owners risk storage of luggage may be provided at an additional charge.
[/citem]

[citem title="12.1 Additional Charges" id="citem_121" parent="collapse_62"]
As a guide additional charges include, but is not limited to the following:

  • Breakages, loss or damage to the apartment or any of its contents Replacement cost
  • Cleaning, specialist treatment charges where more than routine cleaning is required or smoking has occurred £500
  • Inventory and condition reports £200 each time
  • Lost keys, fobs or access cards £50 – £500
  • Call out charge for locked out Guests £50
  • Storage of luggage £20 per night
  • Broadband data download exceeding 1GB (1024MB) per day £10per day
  • Telephone call charges As used
  • Rollaway bed £50 per night
  • Cot F.o.c
  • car parking available on request
  • dry cleaning available on request
  • Personal laundry service available on request
  • extra cleaning available on request
  • VAT and local taxes are payable on all additional charges and where the level of the additional charges is not specified in these conditions, we will charge you the actual cost together with any administration costs.

Prices for additional charges may change at any time. For payment of additional charges see cl.2.3 above.

[/citem]

[citem title="13.1 Health and Safety" id="citem_131" parent="collapse_62"]
We take the health and safety of all our guests seriously. On arrival you should familiarise yourself with the layout of the apartment and building and the health and safety procedures as detailed in your apartment. Where Fin-Ex acts as agent for a preferred supplier, we do not warrant that in booking these apartments on your behalf, that it is managed in accordance with local and national laws including health and safety. You also understand that although a preferred supplier may comply with local and national laws, the rights and remedies under such laws may be different to that of England and Wales.
[/citem]

[citem title="14.1 Quality and Feedback" id="citem_141" parent="collapse_62"]
We are committed to providing quality accommodation and conduct regular audits to ensure that high standards are maintained at the apartments. Many of the apartments are also independently assessed through the Visit Britain Quality in Tourism scheme and details of the star ratings awarded can be found on our website. We also welcome feedback from our guests and ask them to complete a guest satisfaction survey on departure. We value this feedback which provides us with useful information on how we can improve our services further.
[/citem]

[citem title="15.1 Complaints" id="citem_151" parent="collapse_62"]
In the unlikely event that you are dissatisfied with any aspect of your accommodation please notify the apartment manager as soon as possible in the first instance. If you do not give us the opportunity to resolve a problem during your stay, this may affect the final outcome of any complaint received. We aim to deliver the best possible customer service, but in the unlikely event that you are dissatisfied with our service, please contact us by email to manager@theharrington.com , 020 7341 5800
[/citem]

[citem title="16.1 Privacy" id="citem_161" parent="collapse_62"]
We may use your contact details to tell you about our services and apartments including special offers that we think may be of interest to you. If you do not want us to use your contact information please let us know by email to reservations@theharrington.com . All information collected or properly obtained during the booking process will be processed in accordance with our Privacy Policy which, with our Site Terms, is incorporated into these conditions. Telephone calls may be monitored and /or recorded as a security measure, to help us to train our staff and improve our service to you
[/citem]

[citem title="17.1 General" id="citem_171" parent="collapse_62"]
We reserve the right to change these conditions from time to time. If guests are in breach of any of these conditions, we reserve the right to request that guests vacate their apartment immediately. These conditions shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of England and the Courts of England shall have exclusive jurisdiction in relation to any claim, dispute or difference concerning these conditions and any matter arising from them.

[/citem][/collapse]

Last Updated: 5th August 2013

[tcontent class="active" id="dws_first_tab84"]

About

Fin-Ex is an investment company focused on the Buy-Out/Buy-In of  Financial Technology Companies and exclusive residences and luxury serviced apartments in Central London.

Fin-Ex is funded by the Arora Life Settlement and leading global banks. Assets under management exceed £150m (US$240m)

[/tcontent]
[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139175830959384"]

Fin-Tech Investment

In Financial Technology we focus on the following:

  • Trading technologies
  • Trading integration software & analytics
  • Financial media – market commentary & analysis, news and market data

Our highly experienced team understands the opportunities and issues facing the Financial Technology market.

The management team has hands on experience of rapid turnarounds, developing products and growing businesses through helping managers realise their plans.

Our commitment to re-investing profits ensures continual product leadership which creates a dynamic and exciting environment for our staff.

[/tcontent]
[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139175832077784"]

Exclusive Residences

Fin-Ex owns and manages a portfolio of exclusive residences and luxury serviced apartments in Kensington. 

The exclusive residence business emerged from a hobby. Through gradual improvements and careful acquisition it has grown significantly.

We have an in-house design and development team that is capable of realising larger renovation projects of hotels and serviced apartments which are beautiful, functional and long lasting requiring minimal maintenance.

We are continually re-investing to improve product and services to become a market leader. 

[/tcontent]

[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab_wellbeing"]

Wellbeing

We are rolling out Prana Wellbeing a concept of delivering proactive well-being through Pilates, Nordic Walking, Physiotherapy, Yoga, Personal Training and Functional Nutrition to all our properties.  

Prana will take referrals from medical insurance companies and medical clinics for rehabilitation, post injury or pre-post operation care. We work with Medicare Francais,  next door  who provide Osteopathy, Cranial Osteopathy, Chiropractic, Dental, Orthodontics, GP and Radiography

[/tcontent]

[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139175832894884"]

The Future

Fin-Ex will be launching Organic Healthy Dining, Private Residence Bars,Cafes, and more leisure facilities such as Spas, Gymnasium.

We are investing in providing Medical facilities for General Practitioners, Dentists, Orthodontists, Radiologists, Osteopaths and Pharmacy.

We have the management team, systems and financial resources to grow substantially in the coming years.[/tcontent]
[/tcontents]
[/tabs]

item.title: Mickey Arora
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Chairman & Chief Executive

Formerly CEO of MMS Group Holdings Ltd. He led the buyout of MMS International from Standard & Poors and subsequent sale to Informa Plc. Prior he was the Director of Business & Marketing at Dow Jones and held senior positions at Bridge Information systems, Cognotec, Digital Equipment Company. Mickey Graduated from Manchester University in Computer Science and holds an MBA in Corporate Finance & International Marketing. [row class="row-fluid"]
[col class="span12"]

In the Financial Technology space our focus covers the following areas:
  • Trading technologies
  • Trading integration software & analytics
  • Financial media – market commentary & analysis, news and market data
We have a highly experienced team who understand the opportunities and issues facing the Financial Technology market. Our team has hands on experience of rapid turnarounds and growing businesses through helping managers realise their plans. Our commitment to re-investing profits ensures continual product leadership and creates a dynamic and exciting environment for our staff.

item.title: 4CAST Holdings Ltd
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
4CAST is the leading provider of global real time Macro Economic, Fixed Income and Foreign Exchange commentary and analysis. Clients include major global financial institutions and key central banks.
Since its acquisition it has grown head count by 20%, developed new technologies for easier desktop navigation and mobile devices and increased the width & breadth of analysis. In December 2011, it was recognised as the Best Vendor of Research & Strategy by FX Week.

www.4castweb.com

[caption id="attachment_735" align="aligncenter" width="463"] 4CAST Limited displayed on multiple platforms[/caption]

item.title: Reddbook Ltd
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
The Reddbook Directory first published by Hambros Bank in 1957 has a long standing tradition of serving the foreign exchange community as a desktop information reference tool. With over 10,000 dealers listed from 1,200 banks in over 65 countries, the directory continues to be an invaluable tool in the constantly evolving foreign exchange market.

www.reddbook.com

[caption id="attachment_740" align="aligncenter" width="463"] Reddbook displayed on multiple platforms[/caption]

item.title: FX Market Alerts Ltd
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
FXMarketAlerts is a unique tailor-made service providing up-to-the-minute foreign exchange market analysis for the active investor. You can instantly receive FX analysis delivered by email on specific Forex related topics. The service covers technical chart analysis, market flows, central bank insights, economic data, and general market commentary.

www.fxmarketalerts.com

[caption id="attachment_737" align="aligncenter" width="463"] FX Market Alerts displayed on multiple platforms[/caption]

item.title: Design
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: This will be the design page

item.title: Xanadu Interiors
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Xanadu Interiors is a busy and thriving Interior Design Consultancy, based in London, but completing work throughout the UK and Europe. Over 20 years ago, Debbie Hatchwell set up Xanadu Interiors (Southern) as an extension of a family business in Yorkshire, created 15 years prior.
Xanadu Interiors has a large portfolio of private residential clients, as well as a successful corporate residential division specialising in advising property development companies, and creating show homes, serviced apartments and rental refurbishments.
Using a wealth of skill and experience, Xanadu Interiors is able to offer a complete service to both our domestic and international clientele, often well outside a design remit. We manage many projects with our clients out of the country, completing their homes so they run in their absence as a seamless serviced home.
With a commitment to delivering exceptional interior architectural design as well as interior decoration, we can offer a truly comprehensive and individual service to all our clients.

item.title: Workshops
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[tabs]
[thead]
[tab class="active" type="tab" href="#dws_first_tab80" title="Welcome"]
[tab type="tab" href="#dws_tab2581855580" title="Workshops"]
[/thead][tcontents]
[tcontent class="active" id="dws_first_tab80"]

Workshops at Prana Pilates aim to teach you how to create positive and in-depth changes to your body and wellbeing.

The studio atmosphere favours focus, concentration and relaxation, making it the ideal learning environment.

We hope that you will be able to take away what you have learnt and apply to your daily life and exercise regime. You will be given tools to help you get to know your body and how best to work with it to achieve optimal results.

They are designed to complement our range of classes and services. Taught usually within a series but these can be taken individually if required. They are carefully selected to suit and maximise progress. Workshops themes will vary throughout the year and are suitable for both clients and teachers.

We offer you high quality sessions and hope that you will truly enjoy them!

Looking forward to welcoming you,

Lots of love,

[/tcontent]
[tcontent id="dws_tab2581855580"]

Series 1 – Posture and Wellbeing

4 workshops aiming to teach you how to take care of your body and perfect your posture.

Neck and Shoulder

Lower Back and Abs

Legs and Feet

Wobble Board

Series 2 – Getting ready for Summer

This workshop will be a combination of the Nordic Walking Weight Loss programme and specific stretches and strengthening exercises. 

Held over 3 months, a series of 12 workshops

An interval training Nordic Walking session in Hyde Park will be followed by exercise session in the studio with a nutritional talk and diet tips.

A great way to get ready for the Summer and feel great!

Book a Workshop

[collapse id="collapse_28"]
[citem title="Contact the studio" id="citem_34" parent="collapse_28"]
[contact-form-7 id="2112" title="Prana General Contact Form"]
[/citem]
[/collapse]

[/tcontent]
[/tcontents]
[/tabs]

item.title: Small Group Sessions
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
• Groups of up to 4 people with 1 instructor.
  • Each person works on their individually assigned programme, including a combination of Mat Work and equipment.
  • You are encouraged to learn your individual programme so that you can get to know the exercises and are able to apply corrections and master each exercise; progressing the safest and most effective way.
  • You will notice a difference in the way you move and the way you feel about the exercises as your sessions progress.
  • You will begin to notice a difference in your everyday life, the way you hold yourself, the way you sleep, breathe and the way you generally move.
  • The instructor is always on hand to remind you of an exercise, to modify your programme if needed and to add or take away exercises as you both feel necessary.

Book a small group session

[collapse id="collapse_28"]
[citem title="Contact the studio" id="citem_34" parent="collapse_28"]
[contact-form-7 id="2112" title="Prana General Contact Form"]
[/citem]
[/collapse]

item.title: Private Sessions
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
• Individually tailor-made classes to suit your specific needs with a dedicated instructor with you at all times.
  • You will receive full attention from one of our instructors and will be able to book the session at a time that will suit you best.
  • The best way for you to gain a deeper understanding of the Method and your body. You will be working to your highest capacity so that results and changes can be achieved quickly, safely and efficiently.
  • If you have a specific injury, are pre or post operation or pregnancy we would recommend private sessions instead of small group sessions.

Please note that we have limited availability for online bookings of Private sessions. Please contact the studio using the form below to find out the best availability.

[citem title="Contact the studio" id="citem_34" parent="collapse_28"]
[contact-form-7 id="2112" title="Prana General Contact Form"]
[/citem]
[/collapse]

item.title: Teacher Training
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Are you interested in a new, interesting and rewarding Career?

Become a Pilates Instructor with Prana Wellbeing and Totum – Fitness and Wellbeing!

Level 3 Diploma in Teaching Mat Pilates– starting September 2014!

Gordon Thomson and Tatiana Novaes Coelho came together to offer a complete Pilates instructor training. Our education programmes have been designed to meet the needs of today's Pilates professionals.

Pilate’s instructors are currently in high demand to teach in sports facilities, health clubs, studios and rehabilitation environments.

The Diploma in Teaching Mat Pilates is modular and progressive allowing you to start with a very extensive Mat Pilates qualification and continue your education as you see fit.

item.title: Special Offers
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Whatever the date, length and purpose of your stay in London, The Harrington serviced residences and apartments have a Special Offer for you, adding even greater value to staying in serviced residences and apartments.  The Harrington serviced residences and apartments are very much larger than central London hotel rooms and offer many more facilities.

Special Offers currently available include:

Advance Purchase Discount:  get a discounted rate when you pay for your stay on a non-refundable basis at the time of making your reservation.   This also ensures that you pay at the current exchange rate and not what that may be at the time of your stay.

Stay 5 Nights and Save 10%:  benefit from this discount when your stay is for 5 nights or longer without losing out on the flexibility to change dates, or even cancel, if you need to do so.

One Month Stay: enjoy significantly lower, flat rates when you reserve a stay of one month or longer at our 1 Harrington Gardens serviced apartments.  For a longer stay like this, also consider our newly refurbished apartments of a higher standard and specification at 3 Harrington Gardens.

Three Months Stay: even lower, flat rates when you reserve a stay of three months or longer at either 3 Harrington Gardens serviced residence or 1 Harrington Gardens serviced apartments.  On a stay of this length, you really want somewhere that is a home away from home and that is how The Harrington serviced residences and serviced apartments are designed.

[button size="normal" type="default" value="Book Now to take advantage of our specials!!" href="http://localhost/v2.theharrington.combook-now"]

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The Harrington serviced residences and apartments have special offers of different kinds adding even greater value to the benefit of choosing an apartment.

item.title: Philip Lindsell
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Chief Financial Officer

Formerly CFO of MMS Group Holdings Ltd. He executed the sale to Informa Plc alongside Mickey Arora. He has been CFO of a wide range of quoted and private equity backed businesses, specialising in turnaround, refinancing and M&A. Philip graduated from Oxford University in Engineering Science and is a Chartered Accountant. [row class="row-fluid"][col class="span12"]

Contact:

+44 20 7881 8820 plindsell@fin-ex.com [/col][/row]

item.title: Advance Purchase Discounts
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Take advantage of Advance Purchase discounts providing a lower rate when you book and pay for your stay in full ahead of arrival.

Often, airlines offer advance purchase discounts for Non Refundable tickets, so why not take advantage of the same with your stay ?.

Terms of Advance Purchase Discounts:

  • Normally 10% Discount from Best Flexible Rate
  • Book at least 7 days in advance
  • Stay at any time from now up to November 2014
  • Full payment within 24 hours of booking.
  • Non Refundable.
  • We will try to help with any change of dates but a supplement may be payable if rates for the new dates are higher than the original stay.
  • Advance Purchase Rates discounts are strictly subject to availability.
  • Advance Purchase Rates discount is normally offered up to 7 days prior to arrival.
  • We reserve the right to change or remove Advance Purchase Rates Discounts programme at any time without prior notice.  In the event of such a change, existing reservations will be honoured.

Location:

The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens is handily located 2 minutes’ walk from Gloucester Road tube station, South Kensington, with many shops, supermarkets and restaurants in the immediate vicinity.

Exclusive shopping in London’s Knightsbridge or High Street Kensington is a short tube ride or a 10 minute walk away.

Many of London’s main museums – the Natural History Museum, Science Museum and Victoria & Albert Museum are a short walk from The Harrington.

Now is a great time to take advantage of great Advance Purchase discounts and to secure the serviced apartment of your choice by making your booking securely online on on our web site !

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Enjoy lower rates all year round by booking ahead with Advance Purchase Discounts available up to 7 days prior to arrival on serviced apartments.

item.title: Special Offer Discount - 5 Nights and Longer
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
Enjoy a lower rate with our Special Offer Discount when staying 5 nights or longer without losing the flexibility to change dates or even cancel, if you need to do so.

Take the opportunity of the lower rate with Special Offer Discount to spoil yourself with a larger apartment, which are even better value.

Terms of Special Offer Discount:

  • Special Offer Discount on a stay of 5 nights or longer.
  • Stay at any time from now up to November 2014
  • Credit or debit card details are required only to guarantee your reservation.
  • Payment on arrival at The Harrington.
  • Cancel without charge up to 48 hours prior to arrival.
  • Change the dates of stay without penalty.
  • Special Offer Discount is strictly subject to availability.
  • We reserve the right to change or remove Special Offers at any time without prior notice. In the event of such a change, existing reservations will be honoured.

Location:

The Harrington - 1 Harrington Gardens is handily located 2 minutes’ walk from Gloucester Road tube station, with many shops, supermarkets and restaurants in the immediate vicinity.

Exclusive shopping in London's Knightsbridge or High Street Kensington is a short tube ride or a 10 minute walk.

Many of London’s main museums are close by and Oxford Street, Regent Street and Westfield London are a short tube ride away.  The Harrington is also very conveniently placed for events at London’s Earl’s Court and Olympia.

A large number of events take place in London throughout the year.  So, start planning your visit to London now and don’t forget to book your apartment securely at The Harrington web site, taking advantage of our Special Offer Discount.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Our flexible Special Offer Discount on 5 nights or longer in any of our serviced apartments at The Harrington - 1 Harrington Gardens with free cancellation.

item.title: London Serviced Apartments One Month Stay
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
For a stay in a London serviced apartments one month stay and more The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens offers special flat rates for an extended stay.

Our London serviced apartments are much more spacious and comfortable than London hotel rooms with many more facilities well suited to a longer stay, such as a lounge and full kitchens.

Terms of Special Rates for one Month and more:

  • Special Flat Rates for a stay of 29 nights and longer.
  • Stay at any time from now.
  • Credit or debit card details are required to guarantee your reservation.
  • Payment of 1 week’s non-refundable deposit one month prior to arrival.

  • Payment of balance on arrival.

  • Special rates for London serviced apartments one month stay are strictly subject to availability.
  • We reserve the right to change or remove Special Offers at any time without prior notice. In the event of such a change, existing reservations will be honoured.

Our London serviced apartments for one month also include our brand new, fully refurbished, higher specification apartments at The Harrington - 3 Harrington Gardens.  Rates are here.

Location:

1 and 3 Harrington Gardens are perfectly located for a longer stay – just 2 minutes’ walk from Gloucester Road tube station, with many shops, supermarkets and restaurants in the immediate vicinity.

Many of London’s main museums are close by and Oxford Street, Regent Street and Westfield London are a short tube ride away.  The Harrington is also very conveniently placed for events at London’s Earl’s Court and Olympia.

Don’t forget to book your apartment securely at The Harrington web site, on our special rates for London serviced apartments one month stay.

London Serviced Apartments One Month Stay
Special flat rates for London serviced apartments one month stay. Chose one of our serviced apartments for greater comfort and much better facilities.

item.title: The Company
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
[tabs]
[thead]
[tab class="active" type="tab" href="#dws_first_tab84" title="About"]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab139175830959384" title="Fin-Tech"]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab139175832077784" title="Residences"]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab139175832894884" title="Future"]
[/thead] [tcontents]
[tcontent class="active" id="dws_first_tab84"]

About

Fin-Ex Asset Management is a London based management company focusing on private equity investments in the Buy-Out, Buy-In of companies in the Global Financial Technology Sector and manages a property portfolio of exclusive residences and exclusive serviced apartments in Central London. Fin-Ex was formed by Mickey Arora and his management team supported by the Arora Life Settlement Fund and leading London based private equity houses. Assets under management exceed £100m (US$160m) [/tcontent]
[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139175830959384"]

Fin-Tech Investment

In the Financial Technology space our focus covers the following areas:
  • Trading technologies
  • Trading integration software & analytics
  • Financial media – market commentary & analysis, news and market data
We have a highly experienced team who understand the opportunities and issues facing the Financial Technology market. Our team has hands on experience of rapid turnarounds and growing businesses through helping managers realise their plans. Our commitment to re-investing profits ensures continual product leadership and creates a dynamic and exciting environment for our staff. [/tcontent]
[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139175832077784"]

Exclusive Residences

Fin-Ex also manages a property portfolio of exclusive residences and luxury serviced apartments in the Royal Borough of Kensington & Chelsea and is acquiring new properties in Mayfair, Knightsbridge and Belgravia. The exclusive residence business emerged from a hobby. Through gradual improvements and careful acquisition it has grown significantly. We have an in-house design and development team that is capable of realising large renovation developments of hotels and serviced apartments which are beautiful, functional and long lasting requiring minimal maintenance. We are continually re-investing to increase the services we provide. [/tcontent]
[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139175832894884"]

The Future

All future projects will include more leisure facilities such as Spas, Gymnasium, Yoga, Pilates, Organic Healthy Dining, Private Resident Bars. We are investing in providing Medical facilities for General Practitioners, Dentists, Orthodontists, Radiologists, Osteopaths and Pharmacy. We have the management team, systems and financial resources to grow substantially in the coming years.[/tcontent]
[/tcontents]
[/tabs]

item.title: Investment Approach
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
[tabs]
[thead]
[tab class="active" type="tab" href="#dws_first_tab78" title="Fin-Tech"]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab139175871742578" title="Property"]
[/thead]

[tcontents]
[tcontent class="active" id="dws_first_tab78"]

Financial Technology Investment Criteria

  1. Mid Market – buy-out/buy-in of  companies with an enterprise value of £50m – £350m in a substantial market with growth prospects
  2. Strong Management – a must for any transactions, we can help assemble teams if necessary
  3. Pan- European – happy doing transactions outside the UK
  4. Strategy – to grow organisation through organic growth and buy and build

Financial Technology Investment Approach

  1. Complexity – we welcome complex transactions, turnarounds, we are set-up to quickly evaluate proposed transactions
  2. Substantial Resources – we have access to several private equity providers, if required. They have done over 200 transactions in the past 10 years, with equity investment of over £7bn
  3. Specialist – able to undertake deal origination, negotiation, financing, team assembly and execution
  4. Deal Management – we respond quickly to proposals. Also we communicate proposed transactions early to the Investment Committee

[/tcontent]
[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139175871742578"]

Central London Property Investment Criteria

  1. Mid Market – prefer buyouts of on-going concerns with asset size of £10m to £100m with opportunity to improve the asset and improve operations
  2. Location – we seek to invest in Kensington, Chelsea, Knightsbridge, Belgravia, Mayfair, and St James. Will consider asset buyouts in Switzerland, Monaco and Singapore
  3. Style – we prefer to buy assets of historic interest or landmarks which we can restore with modern living
  4. Use – Residential, Serviced Apartments, Hotels, Offices, Car Parks and Land
  5. Title – Freehold only

[/tcontent]
[/tcontents]
[/tabs]

item.title: Funding
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
We have funding agreements / experience with the following funding Partners;

  • Upto £100m($160m) per transaction – Arora Life Settlement Fund
  • Above £100m ($160m) – Alchemy – www.alchemypartners.co.uk
    • Alchemy is a London based Private Equity house managed by Dominic Slade. We have a success track record with Alchemy and they are a key partner in our Financial Technology initiatives.
    • They have invested over £1.6bn of Equity in 60+ transactions
  • Above £125m ($200m) – Bridge Point www.bridgepoint-capital.com
    • BridgePoint is a London private equity house. Financial Technology is managed by Michael Black who runs the Media and Technology team.

item.title: The Structure
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Module 1 – Anatomy and physiology for exercise and health and Principles of exercise, fitness and health.
  • Bones and Joints
  • Muscle and muscle actions
  • Cardiovascular, respiratory and nervous/endocrine systems
  • Components of fitness
  • Principles of training
Assessment of Module 1: Externally set multiple-choice theory paper. Module 2 - Health, Safety and welfare in a fitness environment Assessment of Module 2: worksheet. Module 3 – Know how to support your clients who take part in exercise and physical activity Assessment of Module 3: worksheet. Module 4 – Programming a Pilates teaching session and Delivering a Pilates teaching session to include the basic principles of Mat Pilates, Joseph Pilates’ 34 original Mat exercises, its modifications and progressions. Assessment of Module 4: worksheets, client profile, progressive programme and viva, sessions plan overview, session plan, observed teaching of a practical Pilates session, three months case study. Module 5 – Taking your teaching forward Assessment of Module 5: Teaching a workshop on Joseph Pilates’ original 34 exercises and variations internally assessed worksheet.

item.title: Prerequisites
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: There are no prerequisites for this qualification; however it is recommended that learners have basic level of knowledge and experience of practising Mat Pilates before entry. An interview will take place prior to acceptance on the course. During the program you will be required to prove that you are frequently attending Pilates mat work classes. You will also be required to do supervised teacher training hours at our studio. Hours will be discussed once the course has started. Personal Trainers or holders of other similar level 3 qualification recognised by REPs, might be eligible to have their credits counted towards the final diploma having to complete only Modules 2 and 3 (Pilates). It will not be necessary to complete Module 1 (Exercise and Fitness knowledge). Other qualifications may also be counted, please apply within to see if your qualification can be counted. After you complete your program, we encourage continuing education through our Equipment Courses and workshops. Any further information please contact tatiana@pranawellbeing.com or 07789888738

item.title: Nordic Walking
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
[tabs]
[thead]
[tab class="active" type="tab" href="#dws_first_tab53" title="Nordic Walking"]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab510212153" title="NW and rehabilitation "]
[/thead][tcontents]
[tcontent class="active" id="dws_first_tab53"]

  • Uses specially designed poles to enhance your natural walking experience.
  • The technique is similar to the upper body action of classic cross country skiing.
  • Nordic Walking becomes a genuinely whole body exercise that can be enjoyed at many levels, from walking for health to athletic Nordic running.  
  • More than 10 million people globally enjoy this outdoor activity all year round.
  • burn up to 46% more calories compared to walking without poles
  • release tension in the neck and shoulders
  • improve your posture and gait
  • strengthen your back and abdominal muscles
  • reduce the  impact on the joints

And because Nordic Walking doesn’t feel like hard work you’ll be happy to walk further and for longer.

Nordic Walking is an activity that can be shared by people of different fitness levels. From those who have not exercised for a very long time or dislike traditional sports or gyms to athletes that can incorporate Nordic Walking into their training as either cross training or Nordic running

[button size="normal" type="default" value="Book a Nordic Walking Workshop" href="http://clients.mindbodyonline.com/ws.asp?studioid=49435&stype=-8&sVT=14&sView=day"]

[/citem]
[/collapse]

[/tcontent]
[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab510212153"]

  • The injured person can use the poles for support and guidance.
  • Nordic walking has been known to help with the recovery of:

Mental health & well-being

  • Depression
  • Functional ability elderly
  • Bipolar
  • Pre/Postnatal
  • Peri-menopausal women
  • Workplace health

 

Musculo-skeletal Conditions

  • Fibromyalgia
  • Neck and shoulder pain
  • Lower back pain
  • Loading on knee joints
  • Hip resurfacing

Other Conditions

  • Parkinson's
  • Cardiac rehabilitation
  • Intermittent claudication
  • Breast cancer rehabilitation
  • Cancer patients (HRV, QoL)

 

Top PH issues & lifestyle conditions

  • COPD
  • Obesity
  • Diabetes

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Are you interested in a new, interesting and rewarding Career?

Become a Pilates Instructor with Prana Wellbeing and Totum – Fitness and Wellbeing!

Level 3 Diploma in Teaching Mat Pilates– starting September 2014!

Gordon Thomson and Tatiana Novaes Coelho came together to offer a complete Pilates instructor training. Our education programmes have been designed to meet the needs of today's Pilates professionals.

Pilate’s instructors are currently in high demand to teach in sports facilities, health clubs, studios and rehabilitation environments.

The Diploma in Teaching Mat Pilates is modular and progressive allowing you to start with a very extensive Mat Pilates qualification and continue your education as you see fit.
