item.title: The Fin-Ex Team
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
Mickey Arora
Principal

Formerly CEO of MMS Group Holdings Ltd. He led the buyout of MMS International from Standard & Poors and subsequent sale to Informa Plc. Prior he was the Director of Business & Marketing at Dow Jones and held senior positions at Bridge Information systems, Cognotec, Digital Equipment Company. Mickey Graduated from Manchester University in Computer Science and holds an MBA in Corporate Finance & International Marketing.

Contact: +44 (0) 207 341 5801

Richard J. Barton
Chief Technology Officer

Richard graduated in Computer and Communications Engineering from Farleigh Dickinson University and has graduated from Darden Business School,University of Virginia. Richard began his career at Commodity Quotations Inc where he became VP of Technology. At Standard & Poor’s he was CTO of Comstock and was a key advisor for all technology initiatives, practices on an enterprise-wide basis. He later became responsible for strategic planning, development, global technology operations of editorial & analytical production and Web services. Key accomplishments: the development of a common Web hosting platform for all S&P Web sites and a common content authoring platform for all equity, forex and fixed income services.

Richard joined the buyout team of MMS International as CTO, where he led the global technology planning to create the MMS’s technology platform, infrastructure and new product development strategy.

Contact: +1 914 643 6502

item.title: The Management Team
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
Philip Lindsell
Chief Financial Officer

Formerly CFO of MMS Group Holdings Ltd, where he executed a major business transition and the subsequent sale to Informa Plc. Philip has also been CFO for a wide variety of international quoted and private equity backed companies through M&A situations following an early career in the oil and gas sector. Philip graduated in Engineering Science from Oxford University and is a Chartered Accountant.

Paul Bednarczyk
Head of Research

Paul is 4CAST’s Head of Research and has been with the company from just a year after it was founded. His specialty is G20 FX, using skills developed over nearly twenty years trading for Hill Samuel, Credit Lyonnais and Nationsbank. He was particularly successful in trading ERM realignments, a skill that could yet make a return!

Rowland Park
Head of Product Management

Rowland founded 4CAST in 1994 with the idea that information should be quick to find and easy to assimilate. He developed the technology that made 4CAST the number one supplier of FX market commentary and analysis. As head of product management he leads the initiatives for product development, eCommerce solutions and strategic partnerships. Prior to 4CAST, Rowland was co-founder of IDEAGlobal and a senior executive at Money Market Services (MMS). Rowland holds a degree in Economics from Aix-en-Provence.

Simon Gregory
Chief Technical Officer

Simon joined 4CAST after graduating from Warwick University. Although he likes to specialise in software design and development, over his time at 4CAST he has obtained significant hands on experience in every aspect of 4CAST’s realtime global platform and IT department operations. Simon graduated with 1st class MPhys degree in Physics and was awarded the Styles Prize for Excellence.

item.title: The Property Team
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
Matthew Brooks
General Manager

Matthew has 30 years’ experience in hospitality across a range of hotels and serviced apartments in London and elsewhere in the UK in general management, marketing and revenue roles. Previously, he headed up Marketing and Revenue for Harrington Court Apartments. Prior to that Matthew was a Director of London Town Hotels, where he was also deeply involved in the acquisition and franchising of the group’s 7 hotels. Matthew manages all aspects of the Operations, Marketing and Revenue across the property portfolio.

Contact: +44 (0) 207 341 5804

Fred Verity
Deputy General Manager

Fred, graduated from Durham University in Geography, 2009. After which he spent 18 months fundraising to build a new school in rural Cambodia. He returned to London in 2011 and worked as a lettings negotiator at Marsh & Parsons, a successful London Estate Agency, before pursuing his personal interests in property development. Now at The Harrington he jointly manages the Sales, Marketing, Operations, Reception and Housekeeping Staff for the entire property portfolio with Matthew.

Contact: +44 (0) 207 341 5810

Aid Mehmetaj
Finance Manager

Formerly Global Revenue Manager at 4CAST Limited. At 4CAST he worked closely with the CFO to design, implement the new global multi-currency revenue management system, integrating with the company’s SUN Financial system. Prior, Aid was part of the 4CAST buy-out team at Fin-Ex. Aid graduated from LSBU in Accounting and Finance and is a member of the ACCA.

Contact: +44 (0) 207 341 5803

Nassar Khalil
Non Exec Director

Formerly, COO for Royal Luxury Hotels, where he led the launch of the latest five star property in Qatar. Prior Nassar very successfully developed and launched "base2stay hotels" aka The Nadler Hotels, where he was Operations Director and board member. Nassar has also been head of global standards for Nikko Hotels International and has held other senior management positions at Hilton Worldwide and Kensington Hotels.

With over 23 years of hotel and hospitality expertise, Nassar has a wonderful track record, which has led to him winning numerous awards including Hotel Manager Of The Year in 2005, a GTBS Gold Award and Trip Advisor’s Travellers Choice Award in 2011. Nassar is a Member of the Institute of Hospitality and a Member of the British Institute of Facilities Management. Nassar graduated from Imperial College in Business Studies and holds an MBA in Hospitality & Tourism Management from The London School of Business and Finance.

item.title: 1 Harrington Gardens
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
Set in chic South Kensington, just 2 minutes’ walk from Gloucester Road station and with many shops and a wide variety of restaurants in the immediate vicinity, The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens is a collection of spacious serviced apartments including Studio Apartments, One Bedroom Apartments and Two Bedroom Apartments. Designed and furnished in a contemporary style, your serviced apartment provides much more space and many more facilities than a London hotel room at excellent value in one of the best central London locations. 

Travel direct to other parts of central London as well as from London Heathrow and from the Gatwick Express at Victoria Station.  Most of London’s main museums, the Royal Albert Hall, Kensington Gardens, Hyde Park and exclusive shopping in Knightsbridge are all within walking distance. Your apartment is air conditioned and has a comfortable lounge and dining area, a well equipped kitchen or kitchenette and has flat screen TV with satellite channels and newly boosted free Wifi.  Make The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens your London address.

item.title: 3 Harrington Gardens
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded: A development with modern, contemporary styled apartments set within a renovated period building on this quiet tree lined street in South Kensington. The building has eighteen apartments. All apartments include, wide screen TVs, BluRay players, amplifiers, Apple TV, Apple Airplay & speakers, 100mb broadband, wifi router in every room, fully integrated designer kitchens with Siemens Appliance, white bone china, LHA crystal glassware, video entry, in room safes, ample storage, select American white oak floors, and CCTV through out.

item.title: 1 Southwell Gardens
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded: A new development with modern, contemporary styled apartments set within a renovated period building on this quiet tree lined street in South Kensington. The building is south facing, situated opposite St Stephens Church which provides beautiful views from the apartments. The building has six apartments and a stunning 3 bedroom maisonette with a large private south facing terrace. All apartments include, wide screen TVs, BluRay players, amplifiers, Apple TV, Apple Airplay & speakers, 50mb broadband, wifi router in every room, fully integrated designer kitchens with Siemens Appliance, white bone china, LHA crystal glassware, video entry, in room safes, ample storage, select American white oak floors, and CCTV through out. Southwell Gardens is walking distance to Gloucester Road Underground Station, as well as all the local shops, restaurants and amenities of South Kensington..

item.title: 4 Cornwall Gardens
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded: Lucie Clayton House, used to be a famous finishing school. In the 60′s it successfully added a modelling school with pupils such as Joanna Lumley and Sandra Paul. Lucie Clayton House has been refurbished in a classic modern style, with restored cornicing, arched doors, grand fireplaces, balustrades into 6 luxury apartments, which maintain the building’s natural sense of space. The glass lift provides a natural lightwell. The property is filled with technology such as LCD TV’s in the bathrooms, electric curtains, CCTV, full AV systems.

item.title: Development
item.dc:creator: Fred
item.content:encoded:
[tabs]

[thead]

[tab class="active" type="tab" href="#dws_first_tab89" title="Overview"]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab139531717863489" title="Development"]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab139531720585289" title="Marketing"]
[/thead]

[tcontents]
[tcontent class="active" id="dws_first_tab89"]

 OVERVIEW

Whilst Fin-Ex is 100% focused on being an Investor & operator, we are mindful it is hard to find contractors who can deliver high quality, well designed, durable living space at a sensible price. Therefore, over the past 10years we have created an excellent core renovation team of appx 20 people who plan, design, develop our properties

 PROPERTY SEARCH

Our in-house estate agency that undertakes property search for off-market assets and works closely with the main agents such as Savills, Knight Frank, JLL, Colliers, KFH, Christies, Hamptons International, GVA Grimley, etc.

 PURCHASE CRITERIA

Use       Residential, Serviced Apartments, Hotels, Offices, Car Parks and Land
Size      Buyouts of on-going concerns, £10m to £100m,  with opportunity to improve the asset and operations
Location  Kensington, Chelsea, Knightsbridge, Belgravia, Mayfair, St James. Will consider buyouts in Switzerland, Monaco and Singapore
Style     Prefer assets of historic interest or landmarks which we can restore with modern living
Title     Freehold only

 [/tcontent]

[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139531717863489"]

PLANNING

Fin-Ex has a wealth of experience to navigate through what can sometimes seem to be complex processes. Our planning advisors undertake to propose, discuss planning solutions, prepare and submit planning applications. Through bringing ideas and solutions to positive stages with council planners, we progressively achieve an agreeable conclusions.

DESIGN

Fin-Ex has worked closely with Xanadu interiors to consistently achieve the very best product. Focusing on every small detail to ensure delivery of sophisticated designs with wonderful finishes ultimately maximising the look and feel of each project to be Chic & Elegant.

PROJECT MANAGEMENT

Our in-house project managers deliver the following services :

• planning consents

• space planning/ floor layouts

• designing of bespoke furnishings

• specifications for interiors

• management of the build processes

• sourcing of finishes

• procurement

COSTS / TIMESCALES

Being owner operators, our in-house development team is committed to offer the very best value for money, sticking to budgets, being flexible and delivering high quality of finish. 

[/tcontent]

[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139531720585289"]

Fin-Ex has consistently achieved record breaking prices over the years for many of its renovated properties projects for Sales and Rentals. On the rentals, we have the Large Cap CEOs, heads of Hedge Funds, Global Heads of banks, Heads of Family Offices as tenants, who stay with us for many years, until their circumstances change.

We continue to achieve record breaking prices because of the products we create. We are delighted international investors love the vibrant London. However, we Do NOT rely on market growth. Our business model is continually add value and deliver the best serviced residence. [/tcontent]
[/tcontents]
[/tabs]

item.title: Alan Camp

item.content:encoded: Alan Camp Architects is an established, medium-sized housing and mixed-use practice based in central London, specialising in solving complex development challenges by brokering collaborative solutions.

item.title: Wellbeing
item.dc:creator: Fred
item.content:encoded:
We are rolling out Prana Wellbeing a concept of delivering proactive well-being through Pilates, Nordic Walking, Physiotherapy, Yoga, Personal Training and Functional Nutrition to all our properties.  

Prana will take referrals from medical insurance companies and medical clinics for rehabilitation, post injury or pre-post operation care. We work with Medicare Francais,  next door  who provide Osteopathy, Cranial Osteopathy, Chiropractic, Dental, Orthodontics, GP and Radiography

item.title: Wellbeing Team
item.dc:creator: Fred
item.content:encoded:
Tatiana Novaes Coelho

Born: São Paulo, Brazil

Background

Rehearsal director/choreologist (Benesh Movement Notation)

 Qualifications:

  • Franklin Method, Method Putkisto (Body and Face)
  • Gordon Thomson Teacher Training
  • Alan Herdman Teacher Training Course BodyConditioning & Remedial Exercise
  • Level 3 Diploma in Personal Training
  • Nordic Walking, GP Referral
  • Booty Barre (Plus and Flex and Flow)

In the past few years her expertise with fitness training have included:

  • Fitness expert for Channel 4’s website 4Beauty, Ambassador for Sweaty Betty
  • Teaching Master Classes at Champneys Health Resorts
  • Technical co-ordinator and co-author of CYQ Level 3 Diploma in Teaching Pilates
  • Presenter at the IDS International Dance Teachers Conference at the Royal Ballet School
  • Co-presenter at the APPI Pilates Conference, presenter at Pilates Foundation
  • British Nordic Walking – National Coach
  • Continues to update her knowledge taking part in yearly Pilates and NW conferences

Gordon Thomson

Background:

  • Contemporary and Opera Dance
  • Co-Founder of Body Control Pilates

 Qualifications:

 

  • Alan Herdman Teacher Training Course
  • Numerous Body Conditioning & Remedial Exercise
  • 30 years of pioneering Pilates

His achievements in Pilates include:

  • 30 years ago, opened his first studio at the Urdang Academy
  • Merged with Pineapple Studio Covent Garden, South Kensington
  • 1980 set-up largest studio in London Queensberry Mews
  • Mid 90’s co-founded Body Control Pilates with Lynne Robinson
  • Led the initiative to rehabilitate leading sports athletes cricket, rugby, football, tennis, golf,  players such as Ipswich Football Club, Mike Atherton and Pat Cash
  • Pilates and football coach for Roman Gladiator FC  
  • Presenter at the APPI Pilates Conference every year since inception
  • Co-founder of Pilates Body Europe
  • Co-author of the CYQ Level 3 Diploma in Teaching Pilates with Totum UK Fitness and Wellbeing
  • Authors of numerous books and DVDs including:
    • The Complete Classic Pilates Method
    • Body Control – The Pilates Way
    • Teacher training courses

Carole Hejtmanek

Born in Lyon, France, my passion for yoga began after an exciting journey as both a gymnast and a coach.

I was initially attracted to yoga solely for its physical benefits but amazed at the stress release I would experience post class. As my commitment to my yoga practice steadily grew, I soon began to experience a much more profound release and connection in both mind and spirit. 

My journey took another transformation as I travelled to India, discovering the spiritual roots of yoga as a way of life. This was my first lesson of yoga - "Beyond the Mat".

Now a passionate full-time practitioner and teacher of Vinyasa Flow Yoga, I have been fortunate to have studied under many knowledgeable and well-loved Yoga teachers such as Shiva Rea, Mercedes Ngoh and Annie Carpenter (Los Angeles).

item.title: Pilates
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
[tabs]


[thead]
[tab class="active" type="tab" href="#dws_first_tab21" title="Welcome"]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab139291319047321" title="Services"]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab139291320736621" title="Benefits"]
[/thead]

[tcontents]
[tcontent class="active" id="dws_first_tab21"]

At Prana pilates, our clients enjoy the authentic Pilates method combined with expertise from other disciplines which makes unique.

We aim to strengthen and where necessary rebuild or heal to rehabilitate and increase functional or athletic performance.

Prana Pilates is led by Tatiana Novaes Coelho (studio director). She comes from the world of ballet and choreology, where she has worked with the leading national and international ballet and opera companies.  such as Royal New Zealand ballet, Boston ballet, Washington National Opera. Currently she is the choreologist for ‘Turandot’ at the Royal Opera House in London.

Tatiana’s dance background gives the studio a unique teaching methodology and ethos of continually striving to improve posture and alignment and functionality.

Our clients get great results because we design programs to suit their needs, habits and personality. Pilates is a way of life, a method to enjoy life and to do what we can to ensure quality of life.

We are a modern studio/clinic  on the top floor, with beautiful views of London, located at Penthouse of 1 Harrington Gardens in SW7 4JJ, 50 metres south of Gloucester Road Tube.

See you soon

Tati x

[/tcontent]
[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139291319047321"]

In our boutique studio our teachers provide:

  • Private one-to-one sessions,
  • Small group classes.
  • Workshops
  • Teacher Training accredited by CYQ.
  • Physiotherapy
  • Nordic Walking Classes

Our rehabilitation team is on hand to help you through injury prevention and recovery, pre and post operation or pregnancy programmes.

[/tcontent]
[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139291320736621"]

Pilates is a very precise exercise system which addresses the body as a whole, correcting asymmetries and chronic weaknesses in order to prevent re-injury and re-balance body.

The series of controlled movements engage both mind and body, promoting equilibrium of the body.

Pilates can be extremely gentle when you begin since it was originally created for rehabilitation. However as you progress through the repertoire it becomes extremely challenging and aerobic. It is used by dancers and athletes to optimise performance and reduce injury. The benefits of practice are:

  • balanced body - proportionally developed lower and upper limbs
  • strong and supple muscles and joints
  • a strengthened centre, a flat stomach
  • a lengthened spine
  • muscle tone without adding bulk
  • increased body awareness, flexibility
  • effective breathing patterns, reduced stress

“Pilates is about quality of exercise as opposed to quantity”

[/tcontent]
[/tcontents]


[/tabs]

item.title: Nutrition
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
Weight management

Weight loss – we can help you identify why you are holding onto weight. We can look at your thyroid function, blood sugar control, liver toxicity and eating habits. Alternatively, many people want to put on weight, and increasing calories and fat doesn’t help. The problem is digestion and assimilation of nutrients and focus on the small intestine is beneficial.

[download id="2983"]

Digestive health

Often digestive imbalances present with pain, cramp bloating and general discomfort. Clients can often go through various elimination diets and take endless medicines to alleviate their symptoms. This can lead that the body is unable to absorb nutrients. We can help identify poorly functioning organs, missing enzymes, food allergies, bacterial imbalances and parasites.

Children health

Nutripharm specialise in talking to children, teenagers and parents about health, wellbeing and eating disorders. Did you know that what you feed your child can have a direct influence on their behaviour, concentration ability, reading and writing age? It’s absolutely true. Recent studies of pre-school and primary school age children have shown that with dietary changes and appropriate supplementation a child can potentially increase their reading and writing age by up to 2 years. Nutripharm can also help with foods that help boost your child’s immune system as well as top tips for boosting IQ.

[download id="2985"]

Sports nutrition

Exercise places increased demands on the body and athletes need power and stamina to achieve their goals. We work to keep the cardiovascular system powerful, the lungs expansive and clear. Issues with the bowel and liver are addressed and adrenal energy improved and recharged. The right eating habits, supplementation, vitamins, mineral and protein balance help to optimise performance.

Skin health

The skin is the largest organ of the body and often reflects what is happening internally. Hormonal imbalances, immune responses to external factors such as stress, poor digestive health, and stress can all take their toll on our skin. I can help with eczema, acne and psoriasis. Re-balancing through the right nutrition can help improve the skins appearance.

[download id="2987"]

Emotional health

Food choices can affect our mental health, stress and energy levels. Often, women experience typical PMS symptoms and are at a loss to abate them. Likewise, menopause brings its own set of symptoms, often leaving patients unable to function at a day to day level. We can help treat the cause of this with supplementation at the causal level along with good diet choices to a path of wellbeing.

Adrenal fatigue

Adrenal fatigue is a collection of signs and symptoms, known as a syndrome, that results when the adrenal glands function below the necessary level. Most commonly associated with intense or prolonged stress, it can also arise during or after acute or chronic infections, especially respiratory infections. Divorce, bereavement or just responding to the daily demands of life can bring about adrenal fatigue.

[download id="2989"]

Food intolerances

Most food allergies are hidden. One of the tests for detecting which foods you are sensitive to is the IgG test. This relates to the food that we eat most commonly and most frequently and can relate to gut permeability. If you are unsure what IgG is, it is best explained as a tailor-made weapon in your own body that latches onto specific substances to help escort them out of your body. They are like bouncers on the lookout for a substance that you may be allergic to. The bouncers are called immunoglobulin’s or IgG for short. They are of different types and real heavies are IgE but most food intolerances are probably IgG

[download id="2991"]

Senior health

Growing old gracefully. Unfortunately when we reach our senior years many of us suffer for a lack of energy, joint and muscle pains, poor circulation, poor memory, and digestive disturbance. However, so many of the symptoms can be managed and eased through diet. You don’t have to sit back and just accept your discomfort as though your symptoms are part and parcel of growing old. By changing the way you eat and by taking a few specific nutritional supplements you can start to restore a sense of vitality.

[download id="2993"]

Blood pressure

High blood pressure, or hypertension, is considered to be a blood pressure reading of over 140/90 mmHg (millimetres of mercury), and factors that contribute to high blood pressure include: being over-weight, exposure to long-term stress, smoking, and a high-fat diet. The danger with high blood pressure is that it greatly increases your risk of cardiovascular disease, stroke and heart attack. The good news is that you can take steps to prevent high blood pressure by adopting a healthy diet and lifestyle.

[download id="2993"]

Summertime allergies

For most people the onset of spring with its warmer weather, blossoming trees and blooming flowers is a welcome change from the winter months. But for those who experience hay fever it means stocking up on the tissues and the start of several months of sneezing, itchy, watery eyes and runny noses.

[download id="2995"]

Fertility

Over the past 20 years, the number of couples experiencing fertility problems has increased dramatically. Over 25% of all couples planning a baby have trouble conceiving and more and more are turning to fertility treatments. Many couples in the UK leave it until their mid to late 30’s when the pressure of a ticking biological clock can become a real stress if natural conception doesn’t occur after 1-2 years. Heavy metal toxicity, alcohol, smoking, being overweight, nutrient deficiencies, impaired nutrient absorption, and increasingly stress all play a role in declining fertility rates, and this is not just confined to women, it is estimated that 40% of infertility problems are connected with the man.

[download id="2997"]

[download id="2999"]

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Nutrition wellbeing using foods, mineral and vitamins, therapies and allopathic medicines
Nutrition in optimum wellbeing using foods, mineral and vitamins,allopathic medicine and complementary therapies

item.title: Physiotherapy
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
At Prana Physiotherapy our main priority is the welfare of our clients.

We aim to identify the primary cause of the condition and treat the symptoms focusing on a long term solution rather than just a short term one.

Physiotherapy is the treatment of musculo-skeletal conditions, the remediation of impairments and disabilities and how they affect everyday life.

Our team specialises in sports injuries to occupational health related disorders and some of the conditions treated are: back, neck and joint pain, sports and running injuries, repetitive strain injury, pre and post surgical rehabilitation.

It aims to restore mobility, functional ability, quality of life and movement patterns to prevent reoccurrence of injuries.

It is a combined effort between the physical therapist and the client.

item.title: Personal Training
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:

[/thead][tcontents]
[tcontent class="active" id="dws_first_tab16"]

At Prana Personal Training we deliver high quality, personal and informative training sessions. With detailed exercise prescription and instruction, taking into account both the short and long term goals of our clients.

Programmes are personalised from the unfit/fit, the young/old to the pre/post operations and injury recovery. No matter what your concern, limitation or goal is we will ensure that sessions are tailor made to suit your specific needs.

Sessions are held either at the studio or in Hyde Park using a variety of equipments. Fitness assessments are carried out throughout your training to measure progress.

The aim of our instructors is to educate clients in general health and wellbeing, exercise routine, form and nutrition guidelines.

We are passionate about fitness and wellbeing.

Looking forward to seeing you at the studio and helping you to change your life for the better!

item.title: Yoga
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
"To create a moving meditation" is the focus of our classes which is suitable for both the beginner and experienced student alike who desire to build a challenging, invigorating and dynamic form of practice.

Our take on Vinyasa Flow Yoga combines elements of both creativity (Vinyasa Flow) and precision (Hatha Yoga), in addition to breathwork (Pranayama). The sequencing varies from class to class depending on the needs and energy of the students. Set to diverse, inspiring “yoga music” ranging from World Beats to Trance to New Age sounds, our classes increase both inner and outer strength, develop a sense for energies and chakra isolation-connection, while simultaneously building on flexibility.

Designed with care and intention to promote wellness and strength on all levels - mental, physical and spiritual.

item.title: Nutrition Team
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
I am a fully qualified pharmacist with an understanding of many disease states, allopathic medicine, complementary therapies and homeopathic medicines.

Being a naturopathic nutritionist I appreciate how the diet influences mind, body, and spirit. I enjoy working with clients to educate them about how nutrition and food influences their health and together we create a programme which is both realistic and achievable. This enables clients to take control and manage their own health in a way which is sustainable and natural.

I use the Functional Approach, ensuring an in depth assessment is made in order to understand bio chemical imbalances.

item.title: Personal Training Team
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
Tatiana Novaes Coelho

Born: São Paulo, Brazil

Background

His achievements in Pilates include:

Priscila Albino

Born: São Paulo, Brazil

Background:

Professional Reflexologist and Care Worker

Qualifications:

  • Alan Herdman Teacher Training Course Body Conditioning & Remedial Exercise
  • Madeleine Black : The Psoas as a Core Muscle
  • Karen Clippinger, MSPE: Meeting Functional Demands of the Hip and Knee with Pilates

Teaching style:

Incorporates a holistic and therapeutic approach. Her aim is to make sure a tailored session is addressed to each individual’s needs by paying excellent attention to details and precise corrections, helping you to reeducate body patterns such as good body awareness, emphasizing proper breathing, correcting spinal and pelvic alignment yet achieving a positive connection to your sense of self.

item.title: Yoga Team
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
Carole Hejtmanek

Born in Lyon, France, my passion for yoga began after an exciting journey as both a gymnast and a coach.

I was initially attracted to yoga solely for its physical benefits but amazed at the stress release I would experience post class. As my commitment to my yoga practice steadily grew, I soon began to experience a much more profound release and connection in both mind and spirit. 

My journey took another transformation as I travelled to India, discovering the spiritual roots of yoga as a way of life. This was my first lesson of yoga - "Beyond the Mat".

Now a passionate full-time practitioner and teacher of Vinyasa Flow Yoga, I have been fortunate to have studied under many knowledgeable and well-loved Yoga teachers such as Shiva Rea, Mercedes Ngoh and Annie Carpenter (Los Angeles).

item.title: Testimonials
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
Puja / London

My experience in seeing Rita work with the Asyra is quite astonishing, as she was able to clearly detect the reasons for the symptoms I have been experiencing. In all my years of seeing doctors/specialists and getting blood tests, not one person was able to explain to me the cause of my symptoms. Needless to say I was very relieved to learn of this and have been working with Rita to naturally bring into balance all that needs to be remedied. Rita has been amazingly diligent in preparing a stepwise program for me, as well as answering queries and following-up with tests to monitor the progress. This has been the most comprehensive alternative treatment I have ever received. I am very grateful to Rita for her skill and sincerity.  

Janet / London

Rita is an angel without wings! She is very professional and showed a genuine interest in helping me feel better. The Asyra has highlighted points in my body that needed support. Rita has prescribed supplements which I take religiously. People have started to notice my glow return. I highly recommend you try the Asyra and wait and see what a difference it makes to your energy levels and general well being.  

Avril / London

Having attended Rita's Asyra clinic for post-cancer related issues I am greatly impressed by her breadth and depth of knowledge, her astute understanding, her ability to deliver clear and exact diagnosis and her very humane sensitive nature. Rita has enabled me to better manage my health going forward. I have no hesitation in recommending Rita to those who want to make the changes.  

Yvonne / Spain

 On a recommendation from my daughter, I attended Rita's clinic for Asyra testing and follow up treatment for Candida-related problems which had been dragging on for some years. I am delighted with the results and will continue to follow Rita's recommendations to maintain good health.

item.title: Testimonials
item.dc:creator: Tatiana
item.content:encoded:
"Tatiana and Gordon - a big big thank you to you both!

I can’t imagine my week without my regular Pilates and Nordic walking sessions.

I feel healthier and fitter now than I did in my 20’s. That is all thanks to your

expert tuition and good humour both of which motivate me to come in every week.

Exercise is no longer a chore but a real pleasure!

I wish you both every success in the new studio."

Julietta M Vassilicos

 

"Tatiana and all the other excellent teachers too, are kind, patient and knowledgeable.  An hour's lesson passes in a flash, and I can honestly say that since I started pilates 2 years ago,  my dodgy old back has never felt better."

Caroline Clegg (70)

 

"Tatiana is a precise and dedicated teacher who scrutinises my every move to make sure I am using my body correctly - she especially helped me during my pregnancy when it was very important to get the core muscles working just right"

Homa Rastegar Driver

 

"Gordon and Tatiana, 

I had an absolutely lovely first Session, great fun to see all the  happy and familiar 'old' friends. And blue sky above me, with fluffy white clouds rushing past. Rather surreal and spiritual......thank you.

Well done on a great achievement both of you."

Sandi Lacey

item.title: Restaurants
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
[tabs]
[thead]
[tab class="active" type="tab" href="#dws_first_tab28" title="Cafe"]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab139542133144028" title="French "]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab139542139346728" title="Gastro Pub"]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab139542149880428" title="Indian"]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab139542154942928" title="Italian"]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab139542162635228" title="Oriental"]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab139542167398628" title="Posh Nosh"]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab139542171630428" title="Steakhouse"]
[/thead][tcontents]
[tcontent class="active" id="dws_first_tab28"]

Muriel's Kitchen - The dishes at Muriel’s are inspired by the hearty cooking of the owners mothers and grandmothers and have been developed by their clever chefs to create British classics with a modern twist.

Baker and spice - Each day you will find an array of hand crafted, artisan sourdough breads side by side with an inspiring, seductive range of cooked and prepared foods. Being ingredient led, we use what’s in season, source authentic, local, organic and Fairtrade where possible with an emphasis on British and European produce. [/tcontent]

[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139542133144028"]

La Bouchee - La Bouchée has been a fixture in South Kensington for over 25 years. A rustically cluttered decor of candles, antiques and worn-out wood adds charm and romanticism to this landmark French locale. The food is typical French bistro leaning towards the rustic side of French cuisine, with a great wine list.

Le Colombier - This charming and elegant restaurant situated in the heart of Chelsea fits the bill for both neighbourhood dining or for customers from far and wide wishing to enjoy a relaxed and delicious meal for lunch or dinner. The surroundings are peaceful and the service impeccable to compliment the quintessentially French menu with the accent on Parisian Brasserie dishes. [/tcontent]

[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139542139346728"]

Bumpkin - Bumpkin is all about authentic, seasonal British food and we have scoured the corners of Britain to bring the finest produce to our kitchens. Open for breakfast, elevensies, lunch, afternoon tea or dinner to see what we have on offer each day.

The Duke of Clarence - Conveniently located between Gloucester Road and South Kensington tube stations, this is a classic Geronimo pub, combining traditional British food with all the quality and style you’d expect in Kensington

The Enterprise - the restaurant and bar that’s like a members club… but without the fee

Coco Momo Kensington - Situated on the Kensington Gardens end of Gloucester Road, Coco Momo Cafe' Bar and Brasserie is a casual yet sophisticated restaurant reminiscent of chilled out Parisian dining rooms.

The Angelsea Arms - The Anglesea Arms is found on Selwood Terrace in South Kensington, A beautiful traditional pub that feels older than it looks with warranted reputation for its excellent, high quality gastro pub food and drinks.

The Thomas Cubitt - one of Belgravia’s most celebrated pubs,offering fantastic food and a comfortable atmosphere. The Thomas Cubitt has established itself as a local institution and destination venue in the capital’s most distinguished neighbourhood. [/tcontent]

[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139542149880428"]

Bombay Brasserie - Since 1982 Bombay Brasserie has paved the way for Indian and Bombay cuisine in London. Located in eternally fashionable Kensington, the Bombay Brasserie attracts the glitterati, politico’s, captains of industry and those seeking a dining experience, which will take them to Bombay, if only for a few hours.

Amaya - Situaed in the heart of Belgravia, Amaya offers a unique cusines basd on contemporary Indian food. With a theatricl open grill kitchen and beguiling interiors, Amaya is one of the Londons hottest restaurants.

Star of India - Indian Restaurant offering Authentic Indian Food and Indian Cuisine in South Kensington, London. The menu features a wide range of cooking styles and dishes reflecting the diverse cuisine of the Indian sub-continent.

Chutney Mary - Establised in 1990 in London’s fashionable Chelsea, Chutney Mary is the original contemporary Indian restaurant, responsible for re-defining quintessential Indian cuisine, by bringing together authentic flavours, reflecting traditional recipes using innovative techniques, with world-class presentation [/tcontent]

[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139542154942928"]

La Famiglia - Created by the godfather of Italian chefs, Alvaro Maccioni, it first opened over thirty five years ago. This is as authentic cuisine as anyone will get outside of Tuscany.

Manicomo - Manicomio Restaurant is located at 85 Duke of York Square, just beside the the Saatchi gallery. The menu is seasonal modern Italian. All fish is line-caught and meat is provided by the Ginger Pig. Lunch and dinner are available throughout the week. The extensive heated terrace is perfect for balmy summer evenings or chilly nights.

Rocco - Traditional Italian cuisine. All fresh pastas, bread and dessert are made following true Italian traditions and recipes.

San Lorenzo - Famed as a celeb hangout and favourite of Princess Diana, San Lorenzo tries to create an air of upmarket intimacy with its basement setting and mix of eclectic artwork, yet somehow remains safe and square. Made in Italy - Authentic Italian restaurant chain in London serving fantastic pizzas and pastas and very reasonable prices.

Scalini - One of the oldest traditional fine dining Italian Restaurant left in London, the menu is resolutely Italian, we insist on sourcing from authentic Italian produce from our suppliers based in various regions of Italy.

Wildwood - Wildwood serves freshly prepared Italian food delivered by friendly staff in a relaxed, homely environment. Whether you choose from the grill section, stone-baked pizza or our freshly prepared pastas, their passion for high quality food is the main focus. [/tcontent]

[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139542162635228"]

Good Earth - Family business prides itself on building a reputation for exceptional food and service. From traditional aromatic duck and dry shredded beef to contemporary dishes unique to us, like Wasabi Prawns and Golden Sands Dover Sole.

Hakkasan - Innovatively created cocktails and a unique wine list, are combined with carefully chosen dim sum and Chinese dishes that are ever changing, dynamic and new. The result is authentic Cantonese cooking with a contemporary flare – at once subtle and thrilling - and all made with the best ingredients.

Nobu - With its own street entrance on Old Park Lane, the 150 cover restaurant includes a separate sushi bar and enjoys commanding views across Hyde Park through full-height windows. Roka - Roka, the award winning restaurant, serves contemporary Japanese robatayaki cuisine in striking yet informal surroundings in the heart of London's media district.

Novikov - The Asian Restaurant specialises in Chinese and Pan Asian cuisine, with a menu designed by highly skilled and experienced Japanese-trained Head Chef Jeff Tyler. Tyler is known for his love of experimenting with different textures, flavours and ingredients

Nozomi - A consistent hit with its well-heeled Knightsbridge clientele, Nozomi offers premium Japanese cuisine. As well as an impressive glass atrium in the dining room, resident DJs create a chic late night hangout in the Nozomi bar

Roka - is an award winning restaurant on charlott street, serving contemporary Japanese robatayaki cuisine in striking yet informal surroundings in the heart of London's media district.

Zuma - Zuma in knightsbridge offers something completely new - a sophisticated twist on the traditional japanese izakaya style of informal eating and drinking. The ethos behind zuma is to deliver an authentic flavour of the east while respecting the traditions of the past. [/tcontent]

[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139542167398628"]

Daphne's - With its soft caramel tones and discreet lighting, Daphne’s restaurant at Brompton Cross in London’s South Kensington is elegant and relaxed. Well known and loved by celebrities and their friends, this Chelsea restaurant has been serving classic Italian cuisine for more than 40 years

Launceston Place - A true hidden gem in South Kensington, Michelin-starred Launceston Place serves a flamboyant and seasonally-inspired British menu created by Head Chef Tim Allen. Also awarded four AA Rosettes in 2013, Launceston Place was one of only seven restaurants to receive the accolade in the UK that year as well as being awarded AA ‘Notable Wine List’ and ‘Best Wine List’ at the Tatler Restaurant Awards.

L’Etranger - This jewel box of a restaurant entices the beau monde of Kensington with its Franco-Japanese cooking, impressive wine list and plush decor – all gleaming mirrors, dainty cutlery and sparkling wine glasses.[/tcontent]

[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab139542171630428"]

Gaucho - A world famous steakhouse that prides itself on authenticity, assurance and rigorous attention to obtain the finest quality ingredients at source. This dedication ensures that every time you visit, you experience the true essence of Argentine life. Its food, its wine, its culture and importantly the passion of the people.

Sophie Steakhouse - Sophie’s is great for a business lunch with their express lunchtime menu, a quick steak frites before the cinema or a total blow out in the evening. They serve week-end brunch Saturday & Sunday morning for those who have over done it or bring the family, as they serve a kids menu all day.[/tcontent]
[/tcontents]
[/tabs]

item.title: Events
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
[tabs]
[thead]
[tab class="active" type="tab" href="#dws_first_tab9" title="April"]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab13963437480459" title="May"]
[tab class="" type="tab" href="#dws_tab13963437607319" title="June"]
[/thead][tcontents]
[tcontent class="active" id="dws_first_tab9"]

Dancing on Ice Live Tour 2014  1st - 3rd April 2014 – London Wembley Arena- Witness live ice skating, incredible routines and the much anticipated, globally renowned stars, Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean (Torvill and Dean) for their last year of Dancing on Ice.

The London Bridal Show – 6th – 8th April 2014 – Olympia - The London Bridal Show at Olympia London brings together hundreds of bridal collections under one roof with leading bridal, menswear, occasionwear and accessories manufacturers all present.

Live Tudor Cookery – 5th – 6th Apr – Hampton Court Palace - A great day out where the Tudor kitchen chefs will prepare a fantastic range of traditional dishes for you to enjoy. Showing you traditional recipes, ingredients and cooking methods, the chefs will be doing their best to paint a picture of what Tudor food was really like.

The London Book Fair – 8th – 10th April 2014 – Earls Court - The London Book Fair is a book show that allows you to hear from the publishing industry experts and gain information from the many exhibitors present. Seminars will also take place over the three days to give visitors a further insight into the books of 2014.

The Chocolate Festival 2014 – 11th – 12th April 2014 – Southbank Centre Square (Behind Royal Festival Hall) -  The Chocolate Festival 2014 celebrates everything about chocolate. Create your wn chocolate bar, indulge in award winning hot chocolate and be taken on a journey of discovery through the true flavours of chocolate. 

Property Investor & Home buyer Show – 11th – 12th April 2014 – London ExCel-  The Property Investor Show is a special event for any on ein the property industry who wishes to explore property investment in the UK and internationally. this event offers a unique  sales and business networking opportunity for buyers, landlords and property industry professionals.

Virgin Money London Marathon – 13th April 2014 – Central London - Virgin Money London Marathon Exhibition 2014 promises to be as impressive as ever. Thousands of runners and thousands of spectators will take to the streets of London to enjoy a day of fitness fun.

Royal Philharmonic Orchestra – Various Dates and locatoins – The Royal Philharmonic Orchestra is known as the UK’s most prestigious orchestra. Known for playing to audiences worldwide at the highest standard of music to excite the audience and perform the ultimate concert of classical and modern repertoire of music. 

Hotelympia 2014 – 28th April – 1st May 2014 – London ExCel -  Hotelympia ’14 is the UK’s greatest event for food service and hospitality. A large numbers of things are covered including food and drink, interiors, catering equipment, bathroom & spa, careers & technology and many more. [/tcontent]

[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab13963437480459"]

CEW (UK) Beauty Awards - 2nd May 2014 - London Olympia - CEW (UK) Beauty Awards 2014 helps provide a service for consumers to find the best products in the market for their individual and customers needs. This award is also known as ' The Oscars' of the beauty industry.

Grand Designs Live - 3rd - 11th May 2014 - London Excel -  Grand Designs Live will be the perfect event for anyone with an interest in architecture, building, interiors, shopping, home ware, gardens, bathrooms and kitchens as well as general innovative design.

Pulse 2014 - 11th - 13th May 2014 - Earls Court - Pulse 2014 is a leading retail event. Offering buyers a diverse range of smaller products, from designer gifts to fashion accessories, Pulse '14 in London brings fresh design ability, recognised stylists and global products all under one roof at Earls Court exhibition centre.

Museums + Heritage Show - 14th-15th May - London Olympia - The Museums + Heritage Show 2014 is Britain's primary trade exhibition for galleries, museums and other heritage and cultural attractions.

Caffe Culture 2014 - 14th - 15th May -  London Olympia - Caffe Culture Show 2014  exhibits an excellent selection of leading industry manufacturers and suppliers who can offer new opportunities to coffee retailers and the coffee industry in general.

Royal Windsor Horse Show - 14th - 18th May - Windsor Castle - The Royal Windsor Horse Show 2014 in London will be taking place inside the prestigious private grounds of Windsor Castle. Host to International Jumping, Driving, Dressage and Endurance Competitions with three evening performances on Thursday 15th, Friday 16th and Saturday 17th May.

Business Startup 2014 - 15th - 16th May - London Olympia - Business Startup 2014 is one of the most popular business startup shows in the UK. The show will provide you with all the necessary resources you need to start or grow a business.

RHS Chelsea Flower Show - 20th - 24th May - Royal Hospital - RHS Chelsea Flower Show 2014 in London is an extremely popular and famous event. With exquisitely artistic show-gardens, thousands of plants and products for sale as well as countless celebrities, the RHS Chelsea Flower Show in London offers you an exciting and refreshing experience in the heart of London.

Mind Body Spirit Festival 2014 - 23rd - 26th May - Earls Court -  Mind Body Spirit Festival 2014 in London Earls Court offers you a range of activities to help develop an empowered lifestyle. You can attend free workshops and live stage performances, concerts and meditation sessions.

Graduate fashion Week 2014 - 31st May - 3rd June - Various locations - Celebrating the work of other than thousands of the best BA degree Fashion students from forty (40) Universities across the UK and abroad, Graduate Fashion Week is a crucial event representing the future of fashion.[/tcontent]

[tcontent class="" id="dws_tab13963437607319"]

Olympia International Art & Antiques Fair - 5th -15th June - London Olympia - London International Arts & Antiques Fair 2014 in will present an extensive collection of art and antiques. Excellent examples of arts and antiques from over 200 of the world's most prestigious galleries will be on sale.

MINT Polo in the Park London - 6th -8th June -  A three day celebration of international polo, MINT Polo in the Park, will return to the London's famous Hurlingham Club in Fulham, on the banks of River Thames. MINT Polo in the Park promises three games of Polo each day, a great day out. 

Spitalfields Music Summer Festival - 6th-21st June - Spitalfields Music Summer Festival serves up a quirky and diverse musical experience bringing to life East London’s iconic and hidden spaces with sound.

Royal Academy Summer Exhibition - 9th June - 17th August - The Royal Academy Summer Exhibition is bringing to light of the RA's summer with its yearly celebration of the greatest of British art and sculpture. With works from all media, by popular and completely unknown artists, the show is a unique and much loved show.

The Hampton Court Palace festival - 12th - 24th June - Hampton Court Palace- The festival takes place in the stunning Tudor Base Court of the Palace with world-class acts, spectacular fireworks and sumptuous dining experiences. Hampton Court Palace adds something unique and special to the festival experience, providing a fantastic backdrop to every show. 

Trooping the Colour - 14th June -  Horse Guards Parade - Trooping the Colour is a yearly happening that takes place on in June, marking The Queen's official birthday. Trooping the Colour is single of the most multi-coloured ceremonies held in London.

Cloud Computing World Forum - 17th- 18th June - London Olympia - This show features 8 theatres running at the side of 150 seminars committed to interesting ideas, introductions and information sharing. 

Royal Ascot - 17th - 21st June - The centrepiece of Ascot's year, Royal Ascot is one of Europe's most famous race meetings. It is a major event in the British social calendar and is attended yearly by The Queen and various members of the British Royal Family.

Taste of London 2014 - 19th- 22nd June - Regents Park - Enjoy your summer in London with Taste of London, the UK's biggest open-air drink and food festival, to be held in London Regent's Park. London's best chefs will come out of their kitchens just to give you an idea of what good food tastes like.

Wimbledon Lawn Tennis Championship - 23rd June - 6th July - Wimbledon Lawn Tennis Championship is the oldest and most celebrated tennis tournament in the world. Considered the most important competition in the professional tennis calendar, Wimbledon Lawn Tennis Championship London is always a popular event, drawing in crowds from all over the world. [/tcontent]

[/tcontents]
[/tabs]

item.title: Entertainment
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
Royal Albert Hall - Classical music, rock, pop and jazz, sporting events, galas, banquets and balls and the world-famous Proms series all take place within the Royal Albert Hall's iconic oval walls.

Cine Lumiere - The Cine Lumiere is a shining beacon for all fans of European and World cinema. Attached to the Institut Francais, its programme is varied and intelligent, showcasing the best of foreign film. Located in South Kensington, it regularly screens a mix of French, European and global films, both classics and current releases. All films are screened in their original language, with English subtitles.

The Comedy Store - The Comedy Store is the spiritual home of stand-up in the UK. Despite being the best large comedy venue in the country, the Store still succeeds in creating an intimacy between comic and audience. 

Morton's - The first-floor restaurant, is undoubtedly one of the most striking dining rooms in London. With its picturesque balcony for al fresco summer dining or smoking a cigar, the restaurant is at the very heartbeat of the house.

Whiskey mist - Located in the heart of Mayfair, the sophisticated Whisky Mist at Zeta nightclub is popular with A-list celebrities and glamorous glitterati. Perfect for an intimate evening drink or stylish all-night party, this private member's club is also available for private hire. All events are tailored for a bespoke and memorable experience. Whether it's a spectacular cocktail party or a low key corporate event, the exclusive Whisky Mist is a venue to impress.

Kensington Roof Gardens - London's only rooftop Private Members Club is as glamorous as it comes. Open Friday and Saturday nights between 10pm and 3am on the 6th floor. The dress code is simply "no effort, no entry". Entrance is strictly over 21 years.

Cuckoo Club - Appealing to the more discerning late night London crowd tired of identikit, faceless bars and clubs with no creativity and soul, The Cuckoo Club features 5,000 square feet of ostentatious design, spread over two floors, and a founding committee that reads like a who’s who of creative talent in London, described in the influential Vogue List as “formidable”.

Mahiki - A favourite with young royals and celebs however despite its popularity and ensuing publicity the door policy is really relaxed, there are no guest lists and the Polynesian vibe is chilled out with Tahiti inspired tropical cocktails.

No.3 Cromwell - 3 Cromwell Road, opened its doors in March 2013, a restaurant, bar and club situated in a three storey Georgian town house overlooking South Kensington's Natural History Museum.

item.title: Museums and Galleries
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
Victoria and Albert Museum - The Victoria and Albert Museum (or V & A as everyone calls it) was originally founded in 1852 to inspire and educate British designers and manufacturers. Today it houses over 4 million items spanning centuries and hundreds of cultures.

Natural History Museum - This ornate museum is home to more than 70 million specimens from across the natural world, including insects, fossils and rocks. The Dinosaur gallery is one of the most popular exhibits in the museum, with a giant T. rex, the horned Triceratops and the fossilised skin of an Edmontosaurus.

The Science Museum - The Science Museum in South Kensington houses one of the most comprehensive collections looking at the development of science and industry, and it is all done in a fun and creative way. This museum is one of the most interactive in the city, with lots of hands-on exhibits

Serpentine Gallery - Found in the middle of leafy Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park, The Serpentine provides a platform for contemporary artists, both British and international, with frequent changing exhibitions.

Royal College of Art - The Royal College of Art has a lively programme of exhibitions featuring the work of its postgraduate students. In a further bid to promote artistic excellence it hosts lectures by leading figures from the worlds of art and design, fundraising sales, and other events.

Saatchi Gallery - Gallery for contemporary art in Duke of York Square on the Kings road. The gallery is the only completely free-entry contemporary art museum of its size in the world. Saatchi's goal is to show contemporary work that would otherwise not be seen in London institutions such as Tate Modern

St Paul's Cathedral - St Paul's, with its world-famous dome, is an iconic feature of the London skyline. Step inside and you can enjoy the cathedral's awe-inspiring interior, and uncover fascinating stories about its history.

The National Gallery - The National Gallery is an art museum on Trafalgar Square in London. Founded in 1824, it houses a collection of over 2,300 paintings dating from the mid-13th century to 1900

item.title: London Serviced Residences Three Months stay
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
Enjoy flat weekly rates for your London serviced residences three months stay and more at our 3 Harrington Gardens and 1 Harrington Gardens residences in South Kensington.

Our 3 Harrington Gardens serviced residence features Executive Studio and very Large One Bedroom Apartments newly refurbished throughout with decor and furnishings ideally suited to an extended stay.  Apartments at 3 Harrington Gardens are to a higher specification.

Terms of Special Rates for Three Months and more:

  • Special Flat Rates for a stay of 3 months and longer.
  • Stay at any time from now.
  • Credit or debit card details are required to guarantee your reservation.
  • Payment of 1 week’s non-refundable deposit one month prior to arrival.

  • Payment of balance of the first month on arrival.

  • Special rates for London serviced residences three months stay are strictly subject to availability.
  • We reserve the right to change or remove Special Offers at any time without prior notice. In the event of such a change, existing reservations will be honoured.

Our London serviced residences three months and longer also include our apartments at 1 Harrington Gardens, which are to a lesser specification and budget.  Rates for both serviced residences are here.

Location:

3 and 1 Harrington Gardens are perfectly located for a longer stay – just 2 minutes’ walk from Gloucester Road tube station, with direct routes to the rest of central London.  There are many shops, supermarkets and restaurants in the immediate vicinity.

Many of London’s main museums are close by. Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park are 10 minutes' walk and major shopping areas are a short tube ride away.  The Harrington is also close to London’s Earl’s Court and Olympia.

Don’t forget to book your apartment securely at The Harrington web site, on our special rates for London serviced residences three months stay.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: London serviced residences three months stay
Flat weekly rates for your London serviced residences three months stay and more at 3 Harrington Gardens and 1 Harrington Gardens residences and apartments.

item.title: Health & Fitness
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
If you are interested in achieving a healthy and active lifestyle please visit our sister company Prana Wellbeing where you can sign up for Pilates, Yoga, Nordic walking, Physiotherapy and Personal Training classes. Most of these classes take place at 1 Harrington Gardens in the newly developed penthouse, please ask at reception for more details.

Other local gyms and spas in the area include...

David Lloyd Kensington - Point West, 116 Cromwell Rd, London SW7 4XR

Fitness First - 29-37 Harrington Road, London, SW7 3HD

KX Club - 151 Draycott Avenue, Chelsea, London SW3 3AL 

LA Fitness - 63/81 Pelham Street, London, SW7 2NJ

Santi Spa - 33 Thurloe Street, South Kensington, London, SW7 2LQ

item.title: Shopping
item.dc:creator: will
item.content:encoded:
Kings road- Peter Jones department store marks the start of the King's Road at Sloane Square. Nearby, on the opposite side of the road is the Duke of York pedestrian precinct and the Saatchi art gallery. The further away from Sloane Square you walk, the greater the number of smaller, independent clothes and shoe shops there are, plus a good selection of contemporary furnishing stores. The Kings Road is also a treasure trove of antiques stores- the famous Chelsea Antiques Market for example.

Harrods - Britain's most famous store and possibly the most famous store in the world, Harrods features on many tourist 'must-see' lists - and with good reason. Harrods continues to astonish and intrigue customers from around the world with first-class service, retail theatre, product quality and an unmatched international brand selection. 

High Street Kensington - Kensington High Street is the main shopping street in Kensington, London. Kensington High Street is functional and stylish, with branches of all the usual chain stores in place, and it can be can be less crowded here than in the West End.

Whole Foods Market - The Barkers Building on Kensington High Street used to house an entire department store so you can imagine how much fresh, good-for-you food you can fit into this 80,000 square foot site. While they do prioritise organic produce, not all of it can be categorized as such. Where organic isn't possible, the emphasis is on locally sourced foods that are fresh, wholesome and healthy.
