item.title: Why Choose Serviced Apartments Central London?
item.dc:creator: Matthew
item.content:encoded: It’s no secret that this is the time of year when rates at hotels and serviced apartments central London are at their lowest and that makes it the ideal time to experience the value that serviced apartments central London offer.  The benefits of staying in serviced apartments central London have been covered before, but I have added copies of our floor plans of The Harrington, which I believe will convince you. [caption id="attachment_806" align="aligncenter" width="145"] A Typical* Large Studio Apartment[/caption] The benefits of staying in a serviced apartment at The Harrington are all about value.  With much more space and more facilities at about the same, and sometimes, lower rates serviced apartments simply offer much better value than their hotel equivalents.  Since I would say that, here are some facts and some floor plans: It varies, of course, but a typical quality hotel room in central London is somewhere between 18 to 22 square meters – about 194 to 237 square feet – including the bathroom.  Serviced apartments central London, which also vary, are significantly larger.  Studio Apartments at The Harrington start at about 30 square meters (323 square feet) and go up to 32.25 square meters (347 square feet).  A Two Bedroom Apartment is about 64.5 square meters (694.25 square feet) – very much larger than 2 hotel rooms. It is not all about size, alone, but what goes into that greater space.  The elements that jump out right away when staying in a serviced apartment for the first time are: -  You have a kitchen (with utensils, china, glass and cutlery).  It’s surprising how much independence that immediately gives you to plan your day as you want to without being dictated to by restaurant opening and closing times. -  You have a Lounge and Dining Area – in a One Bedroom or Two Bedroom Apartment these are separate from the bedroom, of course. -  You have space to move around without having to jump over your luggage. At The Harrington serviced apartments you have 24 hour Reception, Daily Housekeeping and good quality Free WiFi – essentially all of the services you need unless you prefer to eat in restaurants, in which case you do have to go out to chose from a wide range of restaurants in Gloucester Road (less than 1 minute’s walk) and elsewhere in South Kensington.  To make that easier, we are developing relationships with nearby restaurants to arrange special deals for The Harrington’s guests. If you are two couples travelling together, the Two Bedroom Apartment is really exceptional value – so much bigger than 2 central London hotel rooms of equivalent standard, with many more facilities including a Lounge where you can all sit together and generally at just about the same cost. Whilst some serviced apartments do have 1 week (or longer) minimum stay requirements, The Harrington accepts reservations from 1 night and upwards – so anybody who might previously have stayed in hotels can stay with us. If you are planning to stay in London for more than an average hotel stay, then, of course, serviced apartments in central London represent even better value with our Special Offers based on your length of stay.  For a stay of several weeks, a serviced apartment is practically a must and we can always talk about rates appropriate for such stays. I hope that showing some floor plans of our serviced apartments central London convinces you and, also just like a hotel, you can book your serviced apartment now online on our web site.  We look forward to welcoming you to The Harrington soon ! *Apartment layout does vary in some cases. Floor plans are a very good indication of typical size and facilities

item.title: The Harrington reveals “understated chic” new logo
item.dc:creator: Matthew
item.content:encoded:
Welcome to The Harrington blog and we’re starting off with news of the launch of The Harrington Serviced Residences new logo, which we think fits perfectly the “under-stated chic” design objective that lies behind all of our residences – including developments at our recently acquired 42 serviced apartments at 1 Harrington Gardens (previously Avni Apartments).

To see the also under-stated chic style to which we develop our serviced residences, visit the pages on our web site relating to our property in Cornwall Gardens – which gained fame as Lucie Clayton House – and Southwell Gardens, both of which have been fully completed.  The 18 apartments at 3 Harrington Gardens are currently under development with some of the apartments now completed and photographed.  All of our properties are located in chic south Kensington, central London. 1 Harrington Gardens continues to operate as serviced apartments available for stays from 1 night upwards and we have already brought this building up to the standard it should be at since it joined The Harrington brand in July.  We are adding some further apartments there and also completely refurbishing what was a dark and gloomy Lobby to make it – you guessed it – under-stated chic.  You can make reservations really securely online for these apartments at www.theharrington.com We will keep this blog updated on a regular basis with items of interest and value to those planning a trip to London, whether for business or for pleasure.  We will let you know about events in central London that might be taking place during the time you stay here, some ideas on how to plan your sightseeing best, tips on where to shop for what and much more to get the most out of your stay in London.  If you have any particular points you would like us to blog about, please feel free to let us know in the comments section below.

item.title: Changes happen at The Harrington Serviced Apartments
item.dc:creator: Matthew
item.content:encoded: Improving our guests' experience was the top priority when our company first acquired what is now The Harrington (formerly Avni Apartments) in South Kensington, central London in July.  That, of course, took some planning and some of the changes were simply creating the standards, which all of our guests had every right to expect within their apartments but which had not previously been fully maintained. That stage of improvements to issues inside apartments has been achieved more than 2 months ago but it is, of course, the nature of any building - serviced apartments or hotel - that small issues do still arise from time to time, and we deal with these as quickly as they happen - we have a full time maintenance team on site along with a Project Manager to make sure everything is running smoothly.  Guests are always encouraged to let us know as quickly as possible of any concern about their apartment, so that we can take care of it right away. [caption id="attachment_1164" align="alignleft" width="168"] Apartment Corridor - Before[/caption] [caption id="attachment_1165" align="aligncenter" width="168"] Apartment Corridor - After[/caption]   The next stage was improvements to the public areas and we are delighted that guests can now really see the benefit of changes taking place.  Apartment corridors on the fifth, fourth and third floors have been finished to the standard shown and re-carpeting of the second and first floor corridors will be completed early next week. Renovation work is still going on in the Lobby to create a welcoming experience of a very high standard for all of our guests as quickly as this can be completed.  Work takes place in the daytime only and the necessarily disruptive work to change the old floor and ceiling was completed some time ago.  Non-disruptive work on decoration, new lighting, tiling of the new floor and new furnishing will be completed very soon.  This was scheduled to have been completed by now but it is the nature of the age of building that we have met a few surprises along the way that slowed the project down. Whilst we regret any brief inconvenience to any of our guests, the photos (amateur for the moment) illustrate that the standard for all of our guests is changing rapidly.  Despite the work, what was a very dark and gloomy Lobby is already very much brighter and more open.  We will be delighted to show off the completed Lobby at The Harrington to all of our clients and guests as soon as it is complete in the next couple of weeks. If you have any concerns about improvements at The Harrington serviced apartments London taking place during your stay, please do write to us on reservations@theharrington.com and we will be happy to update you.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Guests are enjoying changes at The Harrington Serviced Apartments South Kensington central London as corridors are completed and the Lobby nears completion.

item.title: November 2013 Events in central London
item.dc:creator: Matthew
item.content:encoded: As a major global city and quite possibly the most cosmopolitan city in the world, London never fails to surprise visitors with just how much is going on, all year around.  Those who have followed my blog elsewhere are used to a full month of events at a time and I will be getting back to that, but this blog was started a little late, so we get started with what is happening in what is left of November. We cannot possibly cover all events in central London, even for just half a month, but we aim to give you a good flavour of what may be happening during your visit to central London or, of course, what might inspire you to plan that visit ! [caption id="attachment_1179" align="aligncenter" width="300"] Ideal Home Show at Christmas[/caption] Ideal Home Show at Christmas 2013 Earls Court Exhibition Centre, Warwick Road, London SW5 9TA 13th November to 17th November 2013 Building on the outstanding success of the main Ideal Home Show in mid- to late March, the Ideal Home Show at Christmas is only in its 3rd year and is described, by the show organisers, as the "ultimate shopping experience where you can find everything on your Christmas list under one roof.  Whether you are going to shop or simply like to browse, there is fun here for all of the family, including a Live Entertainment, celebrity guests and a special Christmas Ice Rink.  650 exhibitors feature across 7 different sections of the show including Interiors & Home Accessories, Food & Drink sponsored by Regina, Home Improvements & Outdoor Living, Fashion & Beauty sponsored by Lexus, Technology & Gadgets sponsored by Virgin Media, Gifts sponsored by House Beautiful and Decorations. Travel from The Harrington - 1 Harrington Gardens:  Underground (District Line) from Gloucester Road underground station to Earls Court station.  Exit from Earls Court station via the Warwick Road exit and Earls Court is right across the road.  Alternatively, turn right from 1 Harrington Gardens down Gloucester Road and take the first right into Wetherby Place and then straight on down along Wetherby Gardens and Bolton gardens to Earls Court Road.  Cross Earls Court road and walk down Earls Court Square to Warwick Road and turn right along to Earls Court Exhibition Centre. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5ybJyaiV7js BBC Good Food Show 2013 Olympia Grand Hall, Hammersmith Road, Kensington, London W14 8UX 15th November to 17th November 2013 This annual delight for food lovers (and who isn't ?) brings together the talents of several celebrity chefs along with  a set of specialised sections, such as Producers Village (including 'Good Food Champions'), featuring the very best British local and regional produce, some of which are hard to find on a High Street, and where you can try before you buy.  In the Pop Up Restaurant and Street Food Experience you can experience the signature gourmet dishes of many of London's best restaurants.  At The Tasting Theatre you can taste some great foods along with specially chosen accompanying wines and learn how they are prepared.  New for 2013 The Great British bake Off Village is everything the name suggests, focussed on everything to do with baking.  At The Wine Cellar you can explore wines from across the world and stock up for the holiday season.  All in all, there is no better exhibition, whether you simply love food and wine or need some help, ideas and advice in preparing your festive season menus. Travel from The Harrington - 1 Harrington Gardens:  Underground (District Line) from Gloucester Road underground station to Olympia Station.  You are likely to have to change trains at Earls Court Station.  Exit the station and the entrance to the Grand Hall is almost opposite. [caption id="attachment_1201" align="aligncenter" width="300"] London Jazz Festival[/caption] London Jazz Festival 2013 Southbank Centre. Belvedere Road, South Bank, London SE1 8XX 15th November to 24th November 2013 Back for the 21st year, the London Jazz festival actually takes place over a period of 10 days at a range of venues across the capital, of which the Southbank Centre is just one but acts as the hub.  A brochure detailing all of the events and artists involved, many of them world famous acts, is available from the web site and many events are already close to selling out, so making a firm reservation quickly is strongly recommended.  However, do keep an eye on the web site as cancelled tickets are being released back for sale from time to time.  The London Jazz Festival features the range from well known veteran acts to newcomers to the jazz scene.  Other venues include a range of London pubs and restaurants, the Royal Albert Hall, the Barbican Centre, Ronnie Scots club and The Forge.  Whether you are a jazz enthusiast or just have a general liking for something different, take this opportunity to enjoy one of the world's premier jazz festivals. Travel from The Harrington - 1 Harrington Gardens:  depending on the venue you are going to, check your best route and timing on the Transport for London Journey Planner from Gloucester Road station. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZaVSw-V89HE Royal Philharmonic Orchestra: Disney's Fantasia, Live in Concert Royal Albert Hall, Kensington Gore, South Kensington, London SW7 2AP 16th November 2013 Following 2012's hugely successful and popular shows, Disney Fantasia: Live in Concert returns to the Royal Albert Hall for the whole family to enjoy with some brand new content.  Disney shares one of its crown jewels of feature animation showcasing selections from Walt Disney's original Fantasia and Disney's Fantasia 2000, featuring a selection of the magnificent repertoire from both films including Tchaikovsky's The Nutcracker Suite and, performed and screened simultaneously for the first time in the UK, Ponchielli's Dance of the Hours, the great ballet of hippos, elephants, ostriches, and alligators.  Other iconic moments from Disney's stunning footage, such as Mickey Mouse as he dabbles in magic in Dukas's The Sorcerer's Apprentice and the mythical unicorns and winged horses that accompany Beethoven's 'Pastoral' Symphony, will also be shown in high definition on the big screen.  With live underscore by the Royal Philharmonic Concert Orchestra, conducted by Ludwig Wicki, this is another chance to relive this timeless classic for a unique cinematic experience in the majestic setting of the Royal Albert Hall. Travel from The Harrington - 1 Harrington Gardens: walk along Stanhope Gardens and Harrington Road to Stop E at South Kensington and take bus 360 from there to the Royal Albert Hall.  Alternatively, walk along Stanhope Gardens to Queen's Gate.  Turn left into Queen's Gate and walk up to turn right into Prince Consort Road for the Royal Albert Hall. [caption id="attachment_1204" align="aligncenter" width="285"] The British Business Show and Business Startup Show[/caption] Business Startup 2013 and The British Business Show Olympia London, Hammersmith Road, London W14 8UX 28th November and 29th November 2013 At a time when economic recovery is being largely powered by new businesses and expansion of existing small business, Business Startup  is a very important exhibition for anyone considering starting up a business or growing an existing business whilst falling within The Great British Business Show means that there is really a vast amount of advice, help, seminars, networking opportunities and much more available to budding or thriving entrepreneurs.  Combined these make the largest and most important exhibition of its sort in the U.K. each year. Numerous features, including advice from business leaders in a range of seminars and workshops, the "Angels Den" with a series of talks and lectures as well as the live pitching and funding clinics, "The Boardroom" where participants gather around a boardroom table, in a combination of peer-to-peer mentoring and networking activity along with a "Businesses for Sale" section open up a wide range of opportunities for business people to meet peers and expand their appreciation of ways to start up or grow their business. Travel from The Harrington - 1 Harrington Gardens:  Underground (District Line) from Gloucester Road underground station to Olympia Station.  You are likely to have to change trains at Earls Court Station.  Exit the station and the entrance to the Grand Hall is almost opposite. That is just a small selection of events in London to give a taste of what is left in November and doesn't include the many events which may have started in October and continue through November and, possibly, beyond.  If you would like to reserve an apartment for your stay for any of these, please use the box on the top right to select your dates for the very best rates available. If there is anything that we could have included but have not, please do let us know your suggestions.  we will be back very soon with a bigger selection of events in central London to attract you in December.

item.title: December 2013 Events in Central London
item.dc:creator: Matthew
item.content:encoded: As we can't avoid Winter in central London, we prefer to enjoy and celebrate it, which means there is a definitely wintery theme to December 2013 events in central London.  However, as always in central London, there is something for everyone and with a mind to the holiday season coming up this month, it is important to have a variety of events which adults alone and adults and children together can enjoy.  We aim to give you some suggestions as to what you may like to do. [caption id="attachment_1215" align="aligncenter" width="273"] The Ice rink at The Natural History Museum[/caption] Natural History Museum Ice Rink Cromwell Road, South Kensington, SW7 5BD Now to 5th January 2014 Although by no means the only ice rink in central London, this remains one of the best and, importantly, conveniently close to The Harrington Serviced Apartments and Residences.  The ice rink is located in front of the famous Gothic façade of the Natural History Museum and is 1,000 square meters.  Open from 9.00 a.m. to 10.00 p.m. on all days except Sundays, when it closes at 9.00 p.m. this makes for great fun for experienced skaters and novices alike.  For anyone who doesn't want to skate or after a skating session, there is also a Cafe Bar and fairground carousel alongside the ice rink itself, where some of London's best up and coming musicians also play on alternate Thursdays.  Also, look out for a number of Special Offers for Students and parents with toddlers. Travel from The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens:  Walk up Gloucester Road from Harrington Gardens and turn right into Cromwell Road just pas Gloucester Road tube station.  Walk along Cromwell Road to the Natural History Museum. http://youtu.be/0ZeJ8fWJEls The Nutcracker Royal Opera House, Bow Street, Covent Garden, London WC2E 9DD 4th December 2013 to 1th January 2014 Always popular at any time of year, The Nutcracker is especially so at Christmas and the Royal Opera House puts on a glittering performance of the ballet to Tchaikovsky's classical score.  Clara, a young girl, creeps downstairs to get her favourite present on Christmas Eve but a mysterious magician, Drosselmeyer is waiting there to sweep her off on a magical adventure.  Based on a fairytale by E.T.A. Hoffman, The Nutcracker was commissioned by the director of the Russian Imperial Theatre in 1890 after the phenomenal success of Tchaikovscky's 'Sleeping Beauty'.  First performed in 1892 at the Mariinsky Theatre in St Petersburg, it was not initially well received but has, since then, established itself as one of the best loved of ballets around the world with its combination of enchanting choreography and a highly memorable score.  The 'Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy and the 'Waltz of the Snowflakes' are just 2 well known melodies from this famous Christmas-themed ballet. Travel from The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens:  Take the underground (Piccadilly Line) from Gloucester Road station direct to Covent Garden. exit the station to walk down to Covent Garden market and walk along Floral Street and right into Bow Street for the Royal Opera House. [caption id="attachment_1218" align="aligncenter" width="300"] Statoil Masters Tennis at the Royal Albert Hall[/caption] Statoil Masters Tennis 2013 Royal Albert Hall, Kensington Gore, South Kensington London SW7 2AP 4th to 8th December 2013 Better known for hosting concerts, such as the Proms, London's Royal Albert Hall is actually a multi-purpose venue and makes an excellent venue for the Statoil Masters Tennis each year.  The event is very popular and brings back some of the very best known names in tennis - champions from previous years showing their continuing ability to amaze with some stunning tennis.  John McEnroe, Goran Ivanisevic and Tim Henman are joined by Stefan Edberg, Mansour Bahrami and a host of stars in doubles in an event that is now in its 17th year.  The Statoil Masters Tennis is part of the ATP Champions Tour – a circuit of former World Number One tennis players, Grand Slam singles finalists and Davis Cup winners – and is owned and operated by IMG, the global sports, fashion and media company. Travel from The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens: walk along Stanhope Gardens and Harrington Road to Stop E at South Kensington and take bus 360 from there to the Royal Albert Hall.  Alternatively, walk along Stanhope Gardens to Queen’s Gate.  Turn left into Queen’s Gate and walk up to turn right into Prince Consort Road for the Royal Albert Hall. http://youtu.be/U6M4usvG7-E The British Military Tournament 2013 Earls Court Exhibition Centre, Warwick Road, London SW5 9TA 7th and 8th December 2013 Building on the long history of the Royal Tournament, which was stopped in 1999, the British Military Tournament was revived in 2010 with some differences from its predecessor - including the participation of leading British actors and a strong narrative line - but keeping many of the most popular elements to show off the skills of the different arms of the British military.  The British Military Tournament exists to benefit the 3 main national charities of the British Armed Forces - the Royal Navy & Royal Marines Charity; ABF The Soldiers’ Charity; and The Royal Air Force Benevolent Fund.  Audiences of over 50,000 in total witnessed the first event in 2010 and the 2012 British Military Tournament had special significance in marking the life and times of Her Majesty The Queen in her Diamond Jubilee year.   The British Military Tournament has something for everyone: from massed bands to breathtaking displays of precision and prowess from every branch of the armed forces, including specialist branches, such as the Royal Horse Artillery and Royal Marines, the Household Cavalry and the Royal Signals. Travel from The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens:  Underground (District Line) from Gloucester Road underground station to Earls Court station.  Exit from Earls Court station via the Warwick Road exit and Earls Court is right across the road.  Alternatively, turn right from 1 Harrington Gardens down Gloucester Road and take the first right into Wetherby Place and then straight on down along Wetherby Gardens and Bolton Gardens to Earls Court Road.  Cross Earls Court road and walk down Earls Court Square to Warwick Road and turn right along to Earls Court Exhibition Centre. http://youtu.be/uqn9r6cmz9w Live Tudor Cookery at Hampton Court Palace Hampton Court Palace, East Molesey, Surrey KT8 9AU 7th and 8th December 2013 and 27th December 2013 to 1st January 2014 King Henry VIII was the most notorious resident but the Tudor kitchens at Hampton Court Palace provided food for a series of Tudor, Stuart and Georgian monarchs as well as hundreds of courtiers each time.  Hampton Court remains a royal palace today, although it has not been used by the sovereign much since Georgian days.  In recent years the Tudor kitchens have become famous again as a research project run by Historia food archaeologists regularly bring the kitchens to life experimenting with traditional recipes, ingredients and cooking methods to prepare feasts fit for a king.  Live Tudor Cookery gives the opportunity to visitors to Hampton Court to see the chefs at work, utilising Tudor cookware and utensils as well as ingredients commonly used at the time to create meals typical of the royal court during the period.  Admission to Live Tudor cookery is included in admission tickets to the palace and is free to members. Travel from The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens: Underground from Gloucester Road station (District Line) direct to Wimbledon.  Change to take an overground train to Hampton Court for the short walk to Hampton Court Palace. [caption id="attachment_1223" align="aligncenter" width="300"] The Chocolate Festival at London's South Bank Centre[/caption] The Chocolate Festival (part of Festive Markets) Southbank Centre. Belvedere Road, South Bank, London SE1 8XX 13th December to 15th December 2013 As the name suggests, this is a celebration of all things chocolate with tastings, demonstrations and masterclasses.  London's Southbank Centre again hosts this explosion of chocolate as The Chocolate Festival promotes the exceptional and exciting chocolatiers available in the UK and Europe and creates awareness for quality chocolate as well as highlighting ethical trading practices.  Chocolatiers who will be showing and selling their delicious and innovative creations include L'Artisan du Chocolat, Rococo and Duffy's Red Star Chocolate.  Other sweet treats on offer include brownies, chocolate cakes, churros with chocolate, and a great selection of Christmas-themed chocolate gifts.  There will be a range of demonstrations and a daily chocolate quiz, hosted by well-known chef Valentina Harris at The Chocolate Festival Cookery Theatre.  There is also a series of Masters of Chocolate Masterclasses from leading chocolatiers including Damian Allsop and Rococo. Travel from The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens: Underground from Gloucester Road to Embankment on the District Line and then the Bakerloo Line to Waterloo.  Exit Waterloo Station to walk along York Road towards Waterloo Bridge.  Just before the bridge itself, turn left into Belvedere Road for the Southbank Centre. http://youtu.be/RmMq0Bsi2jE Christmas Carol Singalong Royal Albert Hall, Kensington Gore, South Kensington London SW7 2AP 14th December, 19th December and 21st December 2013 If you have a passion for Christmas carols and other Christmas time traditional songs, this is definitely the event for you.  It's hard to imagine a better venue than the Royal Albert Hall, home to the BBC Proms and much more, to really get into the spirit of Christmas as Jonathan Cohen invites the whole audience to sing along to tradiitional cols such as 'O Little Town of Bethlehem' and 'Once in Royal David's City' along with Christmastime songs such as 'Let it Snow', 'Jingle bells' and 'Merry Christmas Everybody'.  The whole event is accompanied by the London Concert orchestra and the London Concert Chorus. Travel from The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens: walk along Stanhope Gardens and Harrington Road to Stop E at South Kensington and take bus 360 from there to the Royal Albert Hall.  Alternatively, walk along Stanhope Gardens to Queen’s Gate.  Turn left into Queen’s Gate and walk up to turn right into Prince Consort Road for the Royal Albert Hall. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5gnHzAmVfw0&feature=share&list=PL3C3038CC49FE7B32 The London International Horse Show Olympia Exhibition Centre, The Grand Hall, Olympia Way, London W14 8UX 16th December to 22nd December 2013 The London International Horse Show is a major event in the equestrian calendar in the UK and includes spectacular top class international competition for  Jumping, Dressage and Driving.  If you are more interested in dogs, the Kennel Club also hold events at the show including The kennel Club Dog Agility Finals.  This year's international event in the London International Horse Show features the Royal Andalusian School of Equestrian Art who show some of their skills in the video above.  Appearing in the UK for the first time in 40 years, the Royal Andalusian School of Equestrian Art are amongst the premier artistes internationally and their show is always a treat to watch.  On 16th December, the High School Gala Evening is dedicated to the full show from the Royal Andalusian School of Equestrian Art. Travel from The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens:  Underground (District Line) from Gloucester Road underground station to Olympia Station.  You are likely to have to change trains at Earls Court Station.  Exit the station and the entrance to the Grand Hall is almost opposite. [caption id="attachment_1226" align="aligncenter" width="300"] Mayor of London's Fireworks Show[/caption] Mayor of London's New Year's Eve Fireworks EDF Energy London Eye, Riverside Building, County Hall, Westminster Bridge, London SE1 7PB 31st December 2013 You can watch from anywhere along central London's embankment, for the best views, although the show is focussed on the London Eye.  Around 250,000 people watch every year as Big Ben chimes in the New Year and the Mayor of London's New Year's Eve Fireworks start, accompanied by music.  There are a number of designated viewing areas which close once full and you are recommended to be on the Embankment very well ahead of the event to get a good spot.  After Big Ben and the Fireworks, celebrations carry on until 12.45 a.m.  Waiting until the very end usually makes it easier to travel back by avoiding the crush when the fireworks finish. Travel from The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens: Once you have decided where you plan to view the Fireworks from, visit the Transport for London Journey Planner for the best advice on how to get there. December 2013 is full of events of various types in central London and it would be impossible to cover them all here.  It's worth noting that we have only covered those events which start in December, so other longer term events, such as London Theatre shows and Museum Exhibitions may well not be covered here.  However, we have tried to give you a taste of the special events that take place in central London in December 2013.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Just Out: December 2013 Events in Central London http://wp.me/p45FBe-jz
December 2013 events in central London offer plenty of great events for adults and families to enjoy whilst staying at The Harrington, central London

item.title: January 2014 Events in Central London
item.dc:creator: Matthew
item.content:encoded: London is a global city that never stops - never stops providing events in central London simply for fun for couples and families or for business.  After the quiet period over Christmas, London gets very quickly back into the swing, starting with the Sales in London's major stores, most of which start on 26th December or 27th December and continue well into January - a great chance to nab a bargain ! [caption id="attachment_1308" align="aligncenter" width="640"] Harrod's Sale from 26th December in London[/caption] January Sales: 26th or 27th December to mid-January Across central London Best known, of course, of all the January sales is the Harrod's sale at the famous Knightsbridge store which is often the site of an unseemly scramble for some really stunning bargains but sales take place across London stores and small shops normally from 26th or 27th December through to the middle of January, with some shops holding the very best deals back to the last couple of weeks.  Oxford Street, Regent Street and Bond Street are, of course, well established major areas to visit for these but the newer shopping centres of Westfield London at Shepherd's Bush and Westfield Stratford have made the choice wider and the events sometimes a little more leisurely than the conventional pace.  Although sales seem to be taking place for much of the year on certain items, there is still nothing quite like the January sales to snap up a post-Christmas bargain. Travel from The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens: depending on where you want to watch the Parade, I recommend consulting the Transport for London Journey Planner to see your best route to get there. http://youtu.be/xxDIgBT0kYE London's New Year's Day Parade: 1st January 2014 Starting in Piccadilly - Trafalgar Square - Whitehall - Parliament Square You just have time to recover from New Year's Eve festivities before the New Year's Day Parade.  One of the largest of its kind in the world, London's New Year's Day Parade celebrates the cosmopolitan nature of central and greater London. In its 26th year, the parade features performers of all kinds from around the world.  The Parade includes some 10,000 performers representing 20 countries, hundreds of thousands of spectators on London's streets and a TV audience around the world of several hundred million.  marching bands, the ever popular cheerleaders, clowns, acrobats represent the contribution of 33 of London's boroughs and the diversity of London's population.  The New Year's Day Parade starts in Piccadilly (outside the Ritz Hotel) at 12 noon and finishes in Parliament square at around 3.15 p.m. Travel from The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens: depending on where you want to watch the Parade, I recommend consulting the Transport for London Journey Planner to see your best route to get there. [caption id="attachment_1296" align="aligncenter" width="300"] The London Boat Show at ExCeL[/caption] London Boat Show: 4th January to 12th January 2014 ExCeL, One Western Gateway, Royal Victoria Dock, London E16 1XL The premier boating event in the U.K. takes place at this point every year and just keeps growing and growing.  This year, The Telegraph Cruise Show takes place at the same time and venue, giving visitors to either show access to both.  Famous for featuring expensive yachts and cruisers, the London Boat Show actually covers the full range of boats of all sizes and to suit all pockets as well as a large number of exhibitors displaying a huge range of associated products to maintain and add to the boat of your hobby.  This year's London Boat Show also features Sir Ben Ainslie and the J.P. Morgan Bar AC45 catamaran.  As usual, the show includes a number of features boats on display inside ExCeL as well as others moored alongside the exhibition centre.  The London Boat Show is the launch in the U.K. and Europe of many of the boats of all sizes featured, so this is an exciting show to see and includes numerous interactive events. Travel from The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens: I recommend taking the underground from Gloucester Road to Westminster, change to the Jubilee Line for the fast route to Canning Town before changing to the DLR 2 stops to Custom House for ExCeL.  An alternative, is to take the District or Circle Line from Gloucester Road station to Tower Hill and then take the DLR from Tower Gateway (separate station) direct to Custom House for ExCeL. http://youtu.be/7uc9lUuJQpE Cirque du Soleil - Quidam: 4th January to 16th February 2014 Royal Albert Hall, Kensington Gore, London SW7 2AP Cirque du Soleil has become almost as eagerly waited part of of January in London as the Harrod's Sale.  Performing each year at the Royal Albert Hall, Cirque du Soleil bring their unique style of storytelling in dance and acrobatics that audiences around the world have come to love.  Young Zoe is bored and her parents ignore her.  To her, her life has lost meaning and she slips into a world of imagination, meeting a range of characters who help her to free her soul.  "Quidam" could be anybody - a person on the train who never speaks, a stranger on a street corner, a nameless passer-by, anyone in a crowd.  These people are the "Quidam" that this colourful show lets speak out and have their voice with all of the imagination that Cirque du Soleil bring to all of their shows. Travel from The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens: walk along Stanhope Gardens and Harrington Road to Stop E at South Kensington and take bus 360 from there to the Royal Albert Hall.  Alternatively, walk along Stanhope Gardens to Queen’s Gate.  Turn left into Queen’s Gate and walk up to turn right into Prince Consort Road for the Royal Albert Hall. http://youtu.be/NT0OlQ15cE4 London International Mime Festival: 8th January to 1st February 2014 Various Venues A popular January event since 1977, the London International Mime Festival takes place at 4 venues across central London - The Barbican, Vamos Theatre Jackson Lane, Leicester Square Theatre and the Platform Theatre in King's Cross.  The Festival highlights the very best in contemporary visual arts including dance, physical theatre, puppetry, circus and live art. Theatre groups comes from across Europe - notably Czech Republic, France, Holland, Italy as well as the UK.  This year's Festival includes 8 UK premieres and 6 London premieres and ranges across thought provoking work exploring issues relevant to today through to the pure entertainment with which mime is more conventionally associated. Travel from The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens: depending on which venue you will be attending, I recommend consulting the Transport for London Journey Planner to see your best route to get there. [caption id="attachment_1297" align="aligncenter" width="300"] London Ice Sculpting festival at Canary Wharf[/caption] London Ice Sculpting Festival: 10th - 12th January 2013 Wood Wharf and Jubilee Place, Canary Wharf, London, E14 5AB The biggest ever London Ice Sculpting Festival has been extended to 3 days and is a free annual event with a lot of cool action for experienced ice sculptors and novices alike.  There will be 3 competitions - Single Block (with the theme of River Life), Freestyle and Big Block (with the theme of Fabulous Fashion) - and 20 international ice sculptors, in 10 competing teams. Competition winners will be decided by a panel of art experts and the public.  Masterclasses enable anyone over the age of 12 to pick up a chisel and learn the basics of ice sculpting whilst an Ice Graffiti Wall gives adults the chance to display their talents.  The Snowpit is for children of all ages to dive into real snow and enjoy making snowmen, snowballs and more. Travel from The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens: Take the Circle or District Line from Gloucester Road to Westminster and change to the Jubilee Line Southbound for Canary Wharf. http://youtu.be/nsI0d3w55hY Top Drawer: 12th - 14th January 2013 Earls Court Exhibition, Warwick Road, London SW5 Top Drawer describes itself as "the U.K.'s leading event for design-led gifts, lifestyle and fashion accessories" and is now held twice a year at London's Earls Court.  It is a trade show only but appeals to a wide professional audience of some 15,000 visitors - largely buyers from brands, large and small, looking to source new ranges.  Split into 5 zones - Gift, Fashion, Stationary & Greetings, Children's and Wellbeing - there is something here for the entire retail industry.  At the time of writing, registration for the event is still open. Travel from The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens:  Underground (District Line) from Gloucester Road underground station to Earls Court station.  Exit from Earls Court station via the Warwick Road exit and Earls Court is right across the road.  Alternatively, turn right from 1 Harrington Gardens down Gloucester Road and take the first right into Wetherby Place and then straight on down along Wetherby Gardens and Bolton Gardens to Earls Court Road.  Cross Earls Court road and walk down Earls Court Square to Warwick Road and turn right along to Earls Court Exhibition Centre. http://youtu.be/J5pDmxj4P98 France Show: 17th to 19th January 2014 Earls Court Exhibition, Warwick Road, London SW5 Whether you have a passion for all things French, a desire to travel to France or a longing to acquire a property there, the largest such exhibition in the UK brings you all of these things, and more.  The France Show brings together french food, drink, cookery, language and culture, travel and property (including legal advice and assistance) all together under one roof.  With a wide range of exhibitors, you can buy authentic French products that are not readily available here.  There are also many interactive opportunities - from cookery classes to the Language Theatre and many promotional prizes to be won, including a week's free language course in Lyon.  If you are looking for a property in France, there are property seminars and workshops as well as details of properties available and the chance to get advice on aspects of purchasing a property abroad, which you may not have considered or which concern you. Travel from The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens:  Underground (District Line) from Gloucester Road underground station to Earls Court station.  Exit from Earls Court station via the Warwick Road exit and Earls Court is right across the road.  Alternatively, turn right from 1 Harrington Gardens down Gloucester Road and take the first right into Wetherby Place and then straight on down along Wetherby Gardens and Bolton Gardens to Earls Court Road.  Cross Earls Court road and walk down Earls Court Square to Warwick Road and turn right along to Earls Court Exhibition Centre. http://youtu.be/YVhSWauaxss BETT 2014: 22nd to 25th January 2014 ExCeL, One Western Gateway, Royal Victoria Dock, London E16 1XL Bett is the major global event held each January in London for the education technology community and a rapidly growing area of interest covering all stages of education from primary education through to adult workplace education.  35,000 educators and those engaged in creating the technology to help learning come together under one roof.  A range of experienced professionals speak at a wide choice of events from the Arena to a School Leaders Summit, Workplace Learning Summit, Technology in Higher Learning Summit and more.  Professor Stephen Heppell, who is described as "Europe's leading online learning expert" gives 4 days of demonstrations of how creativity, flexibility and technology can combine to transform learning and teaching in schools.  Aside from seminars, a large number of exhibitors show off their technology solutions for use in education. Travel from The Harrington – 1 Harrington Gardens: I recommend taking the underground from Gloucester Road to Westminster, change to the Jubilee Line for the fast route to Canning Town before changing to the DLR 2 stops to Custom House for ExCeL.  An alternative, is to take the District or Circle Line from Gloucester Road station to Tower Hill and then take the DLR from Tower Gateway (separate station) direct to Custom House for ExCeL. This is just a small selection of January events in central London to give you a taste.  There are many more events starting in January at various venues and other events worth seeing which may have started in December or earlier and continue into January and beyond.  Amongst these are Winter events, such as the various Ice Rinks at locations such as the Natural History Museum and Winter Wonderland at Hyde Park.  Additionally, of course, there is always an excellent selection of shows to be seen in London's theatres and these do get booked up quite well event in January, so it is best to make arrangements as early as possible. If there are any events that you feel that I should have covered but didn't, feel free to let me know and I would be happy to add them.  In the meantime, I hope you find this selection helpful when planning your January visit to London.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: London is a global city that never stops - never stops providing events in central London simply for fun for couples and families or for business.

item.title: The McGraw-Hill Companies sells MMS International
item.dc:creator: will
item.excerpt:encoded: The McGraw-Hill Companies (NYSE:MHP) today announced it has sold MMS International, a unit of Standard & Poor's, which provides real time fixed income and foreign exchange commentary and analysis, to MMS Group Ltd., a newly formed company. Terms were not disclosed.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
"Standard & Poor's strategy is to direct resources to those businesses where we have significant market presence and hence greater opportunities for financial growth. We are proud of our affiliation with MMS over the past 13 years and we are pleased that the people and the business will continue their outstanding contribution to the financial marketplace under new ownership," said Leo O'Neill, president of Standard & Poor's.
With offices in the world's major financial centers, MMS has built a strong client base and reputation. "Under the new framework we will be in a better position to grow our real time market commentary and analysis franchise," said Mickey Arora, President and CEO of MMS Group Ltd.. "With the wealth of experience the new owners bring in similar ventures, we will be able to explore other opportunities in the market."
MMS Group Ltd. has been formed by a combination of institutional funds advised by Alchemy Partners LLP, the Halifax Bank of Scotland, plus senior MMS managers, led by Mickey Arora. Mr. Arora has extensive experience in this market, most recently with Dow Jones Newswires, as the Business and Marketing Director for Europe Middle East and Africa.
"MMS Group Ltd. looks forward to supporting employee initiatives and efforts designed to build our business. These will include increasing the breadth and depth of market coverage and the development of new delivery channels to better serve the growing demand for independent commentary and analysis in the financial markets," said Mr. Arora.

item.title: MMS International launches credit and derivatives data service
item.dc:creator: will
item.excerpt:encoded: London-based MMS International, a provider of real-time financial commentary and analysis, has launched a new credit and derivatives information service. The Credit & Derivatives Insight (CDI) service spans some 200+ pages covering the European, American and Asian credit and derivatives markets.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
The service delivers real-time commentary and analysis on the performance, sentiment and dynamics of both credit and derivative markets, and offers actionable trading opportunities and dynamic hedging strategies. In addition CDI supplies information about rumoured issuance through to official mandates, first pricing, reception, secondary trading, rating changes, relative value/cash switch ideas and CDS basis reports.
For derivatives traders, CDI provides volatility and swaption analysis as well as detailed flow commentary and independent fundamental analysis of all major interest rate swap markets.
MMS International also supplies fixed income and foreign exchange commentary and analysis. Mickey Arora, chief executive officer of MMS Group, says the company has been working towards launching the service since acquiring MMS from Standard & Poor's last year.
He adds that the service opens up a whole new market for the firm, which will continue to develop CDI.
CDI is available via market data distribution vendors such as Bloomberg, Reuters and MoneyLine Telerate, as well over MMS' own desktop Internet service.

item.title: Informa Acquires MMS Group Holdings Ltd
item.dc:creator: will
item.excerpt:encoded: Informa Group plc, the business information group, is pleased to announce the acquisition of MMS Group Holdings Limited (“MMS”), a leading provider of real time market commentary and analysis primarily for the fixed income and foreign exchange markets, for a consideration of circa US$37 million (£23.7million) on a cash and debt free basis (the "Acquisition").

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
MMS

Founded in 1974, MMS is one of the leading providers of real time market commentary and analysis for the global fixed income and foreign exchange markets, with more than 20,000 subscribers worldwide. The MMS product suite includes Credit Derivatives Market Insight, Emerging Markets Insight, Global Fixed Income Insight and Currency Market Insight, all of which are screen-based and distributed via third-party vendors (including Reuters and Bloomberg) and through the MMS website, globalmarkets.com. Customers are predominantly investment banks and brokerages, but also include central banks and corporate treasuries. Market coverage is maintained from offices in London, New York, Hong Kong, Frankfurt, San Francisco, Tokyo, Singapore, Sydney, Toronto, and by a staff of approximately 190 professionals. For the four months ended 31 December 2002 MMS reported a pre tax profit of $138,000 and an operating profit of $1,434,000 on turnover of $11,023,000. Net assets as at 31 December 2002 were $1,485,000. The unaudited results for the six month period to 30 June 2003 show an operating profit of $942,000 on turnover of $16,809,000.

Impact on the group

MMS provides similar products to MCM, a wholly owned subsidiary of Informa. By combining the best of the existing MCM and MMS products and providing users with additional offerings and options, the integration of MCM and MMS is expected to enable us create one of the world’s foremost authorities for market commentary and analysis covering the capital markets. In addition, Informa believes that there will be opportunities to realise significant savings as the businesses are integrated. Implementation of the integration plan is estimated to take 4-6 months at a cost of up to $10m. We estimate that annualised cost savings equivalent to this additional investment will be achieved within two years from the completion of the integration by the end of the first quarter of 2004. The Acquisition is expected to be earnings enhancing in the year ending 31 December 2004. MMS is currently owned 68% by the funds comprising the Alchemy Plan which are advised by Alchemy Partners LLP and managed by Alchemy Partners (Guernsey) Limited (“Alchemy”), with the remaining 32% being held by individuals (the “Individual Shareholders”). It is intended that the consideration for the Acquisition will be funded in part from the proceeds of the cash and vendor placings (together, the “Placing”) also being announced today, details of which are set out below. In the event that the placing does not proceed, Informa will fund the Acquisition wholly through its existing debt facilities. The Acquisition is expected to complete on 11 September 2003.

Details of the Placing

Under the Placing Informa is raising up to approximately £26 million in relation to the funding of the Acquisition, related fees and the integration plan. The shares issued pursuant to the Placing (the “New Shares”) will, when issued, rank pari passu in all respects with the existing issued shares of Informa. In connection with the Placing, Informa has today entered into a placing agreement ("the Placing Agreement") with UBS Limited (“UBS” or “UBS Investment Bank”), pursuant to which UBS has conditionally agreed to use its reasonable endeavours to procure subscribers for the New Shares. The Placing will be conducted through a bookbuilding process and is not underwritten. Details of the number of New Shares to be issued and the price at which they are offered are expected to be determined and announced as soon as practicable after the Placing closes. Application has been made to the UK Listing Authority and to the London Stock Exchange for the New Shares to be admitted to listing on the Official List and to trading on the London Stock Exchange's market for listed securities respectively (together "Admission"). It is expected that Admission will become effective and dealings will commence in the New Shares at 8.00 am on 11 September 2003. The Placing is conditional, inter alia, upon Admission becoming effective by 8.00 am on 11 September 2003 (or such later time and/or date as UBS may agree) and on no force majeure event or material adverse change having occurred before Admission becomes effective. The Placing is also conditional on the completion of the Acquisition. Informa is being advised by UBS Investment Bank in connection with the Placing. Peter Rigby, Chairman of Informa, commented: "I am delighted that we have had the opportunity to acquire MMS as this is a business which we have long wished to combine with MCM. The business is in one of our core markets, providing value added, must have information and analysis to business customers on a subscription basis. As a leading provider of information in the fixed income and foreign exchange markets, the addition of MMS is expected to enable us to create one of the world’s foremost authorities for market commentary and analysis regarding the capital markets. The acquisition is in line with our strategy of acquiring value-added subscription services. Subscription businesses currently account for 33% of Group revenues and around 43% of Group operating profit (pre goodwill amortisation and exceptional costs). We see considerable growth opportunities both organically and through acquisition in this area, with subscription revenues becoming the dominant revenue stream for the business as we go forward.” Contacts:

item.title: MMS to Expand after Sales Staff Leaves
item.dc:creator: will
item.excerpt:encoded: MMS International, the third-party foreign exchange and fixed income analysis provider that Standard & Poor’s sold last year, is looking to build up its sales team after its European sales staff based in Paris left earlier this month.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Sources close to the company tell Inside Market Data that Philippe Savajols, Sebastien Parsini and Zenja Randjelovic, who constituted MMS’ European sales team, were all laid off.
Mickey Arora, president and chief executive of MMS, declines to comment on the three employees for legal reasons, although he confirms their departures. But he says he is looking to hire a sales manager and between five and nine account managers to take over the sales duties that they previously carried out.
Also leaving MMS is Chris Elvin, the company’s financial controller. Philip Lindsell, the company’s chief financial officer, will take over Elvin’s duties. Arora says Elvin is leaving for personal reasons.
But Arora denies reports that MMS has been laying off key staff since last October and has downsized its Paris office in a bid to lower operating costs for the firm. "There is no cost cutting. We are a financially healthy company," he says. Since October, a number of executives have left the company, including senior manager Alan Parmenter and Ada Li, who was sales director for Asia Pacific (IMD, Nov. 18, 2002).
Arora says Parmenter left because there was no global position available for him while Li resigned for personal reasons.
He also says he is looking to build up the company and is continuing to hire.
There are a number of openings at the company in Europe, including Continental Europe sales manager; between two and four account manager positions for France and the Benelux countries; and one account manager position for each of three regions: Switzerland and Austria; Germany; and Spain, Portugal, Greece and Turkey. The company is looking for one or two account managers for Italy also.
The new hires will be based in the Paris and London offices, Arora says.
Standard & Poor’s sold MMS to a newly formed company led by Arora and funded by Alchemy Partners, the Halifax Bank of Scotland and senior MMS managers last year(IMD, Sept. 23, 2002).
Arora previously worked at Dow Jones Newswires as the business and marketing director for EMEA.
 
Kirsten Hyde

item.title: Global Forex Trading partners with MMS International
item.dc:creator: will
item.excerpt:encoded: New Partnership Will Enable GFT's Investors to Make More Informed Decisions The investors who use the Global Forex Trading dealing platform, DealBookFX, will now have even more up-to-date, reliable, expert commentary and analysis thanks to the company's newly established partnership with MMS International.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
The investors who use the Global Forex Trading dealing platform, DealBookFX, will now have even more up-to-date, reliable, expert commentary and analysis thanks to the company's newly established partnership with MMS International. MMS International is a source for independent investment information, commentary and analysis to the global financial markets. The company has received recognition and awards for being the best providers of FX analysis and commentary by the FX Week publications. MMS has over 110 analysts, strategists and market experts, who are continually interpreting global market information, providing profitable trading strategies. Global Forex Trading is offering key aspects of the MMS commentary at no charge to the investors who use DealBookFX, Global Forex Trading's proprietary dealing platform. Traders who log on as usual will have access to slices of MMS's award winning commentary and analysis services. “We are very enthusiastic about partnering with MMS International," Gary Tilkin, president and CEO of Global Forex Trading, said. "Our GFT investors will benefit tremendously from this valuable information and it will enable them to make more informed and up-to-date trading decisions. And, now through this partnership, the smaller investor can now access the same information that larger financial institutions around the world have long enjoyed." Mickey Arora, president and CEO of MMS International, is pleased to establish this new partnership. "We are delighted to be partnering with Global Forex Trading, and provide their customers with key slices of MMS content to enable them to trade more profitably", Arora said.

About Global Forex Trading

Global Forex Trading trades in over 40 currency pairs, offers a 24-hour live trading desk and the benefit of Market Mentor™ and powerful timing tools to help traders spot the best times to trade. Through its global network of referring parties, Global Forex Trading makes its services available worldwide. MMS International was founded in 1974 and is a leading provider of award-winning, independent market analysis and commentary on global sovereign fixed income, credit markets, forex and emerging markets. Headquartered in London, MMS International has over 110 economists, strategists and technical analysts, working in 11 financial centres around the world. MMS International provides authoritative in-depth local market analysis covering 55 economies, 24 hours a day. Its independent analysis and viewpoints provide clients with innovative and profitable trading strategies. For further information, visit www.GLOBALMARKETS.com. CONTACT: Kelly Smallegan North Star Public Relations (616)235-9581 (ksmallegan@northstar-pr.com)

item.title: The McGraw-Hill Companies Sells MMS International
item.dc:creator: will
item.excerpt:encoded: The McGraw-Hill Companies (NYSE: MHP) today announced it has sold MMS International, a unit of Standard & Poor's, which provides real time fixed income and foreign exchange commentary and analysis, to MMS Group Ltd., a newly formed company. Terms were not disclosed.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
"Standard & Poor's strategy is to direct resources to those businesses where we have significant market presence and hence greater opportunities for financial growth. We are proud of our affiliation with MMS over the past 13 years and we are pleased that the people and the business will continue their outstanding contribution to the financial marketplace under new ownership," said Leo O'Neill, president of Standard & Poor's.
With offices in the world's major financial centers, MMS has built a strong client base and reputation. "Under the new framework we will be in a better position to grow our real time market commentary and analysis franchise," said Mickey Arora, President and CEO of MMS Group Ltd. "With the wealth of experience the new owners bring in similar ventures, we will be able to explore other opportunities in the market."
MMS Group Ltd. has been formed by a combination of institutional funds advised by Alchemy Partners LLP, the Halifax Bank of Scotland, plus senior MMS managers, led by Mickey Arora. Mr. Arora has extensive experience in this market, most recently with Dow Jones Newswires, as the Business and Marketing Director for Europe Middle East and Africa.
"MMS Group Ltd. looks forward to supporting employee initiatives and efforts designed to build our business. These will include increasing the breadth and depth of market coverage and the development of new delivery channels to better serve the growing demand for independent commentary and analysis in the financial markets," said Mr. Arora.
Standard & Poor's is a leader in providing widely recognized financial data, analytical research and investment and credit opinions to the global capital markets. With more than 5,000 employees located in 18 countries, Standard & Poor's is an integral part of the global financial infrastructure. Additional information is available at http://www.standardandpoors.com
Founded in 1888, The McGraw-Hill Companies is a global information services provider meeting worldwide needs in the financial services, education and business information markets through leading brands such as Standard & Poor's, BusinessWeek and McGraw-Hill Education. The Corporation has more than 350 offices in 33 countries. Sales in 2001 were $4.6 billion. Additional information is available at http://www.mcgraw-hill.com.
Founded in 1974, MMS International is a leading provider of award-winning, independent in-depth market analysis and commentary of the global fixed income, forex & emerging markets. Headquartered in London, MMS International has over 110 economists, strategists and technical analysts, working in 11 financial centres around the world. MMS International provides authoritative local market insight for more than 55 national markets, 24 hours a day. Its independent analysis, viewpoints and trading strategies provide clients with innovative ideas, unbiased opinion and a clear representation of all pertinent facts.
MMS International supplies analysis to over 2000 financial institutions globally. Its products continually receive acclaim including being voted 'Best Screen based FX analysis service' for six consecutive years (1995-2001) by readers of FX Week, described as 'Best of the Web' by Forbes Magazine, 'one of the world's best web portals for financial information' by the Financial Times and consistently voted #1 in the Reuters Foreign Exchange Poll.
Analysis is delivered through a number of channels including direct delivery to company internet and intranet sites and via others platforms including Bloomberg, Moneyline Telerate, Radianz, Reuters and Standard & Poor's ComStock.
Source: Standard & Poor's

item.title: MMS set to debut analytics tool
item.dc:creator: will
item.excerpt:encoded: MMS International, a provider of real-time independent market commentary and analysis, is set to complete beta-testing for the launch of a new credit and derivatives product later this month.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Credit & Derivatives Insight (CDI) offers fundamental and quantitative analysis on Eurobonds, swaps, swaptions and credit default swaps with an emphasis on providing executable trading ideas. The platform also provides detailed reports on market activity as measured by intra-day changes to yield curve gradients, single swap/benchmark spreads and direction.
As well as analytical commentary on rumoured, announced and recently priced Eurobond issues in euros, dollars, sterling and Scandinavian currencies, CDI is set to cover US dollar agencies, asset-backed securities and domestic bonds.
In the secondary market, CDI comments on relative value opportunities for euro- and sterling-denominated bonds with a minimum outstanding of €500 million. And credit indices are also reported on, with analysis of the effects of rating drift, curve developments and equity market direction on credit appetite.
CDI claims to be the first complete package for the credit and derivatives market, combining in-depth flow coverage, trade recommendations and benchmark surveys for all instruments. CDI’s European product manager, Frank Claus, says: “We developed Credit & Derivatives Insight with the objective of a comprehensive one-stop shop for credit market professionals.”
MMS International’s president and CEO, Mickey Arora, says: “This is an exciting opportunity for MMS to provide market participants with a better understanding of the dynamics, colour and interaction of the credit and derivatives markets, and will add yet another string to our bow in terms of overall product offerings.”
A division of rating agency Standard & Poor’s until its sale in September 2002, MMS International provides global fixed-income, forex and emerging markets analysis, working in 11 financial centres around the world. MMS also provides 24 hour coverage of local markets in 55 economies. www.globalmarkets.com

item.title: Overseas super-rich fuel boom in London’s luxury market
item.dc:creator: will
item.excerpt:encoded: Oil money is once again flowing through the arteries of Central London. This week it was revealed that a Middle Eastern buyer had bought a £28 million flat at One Hyde Park in Knightsbridge, setting a new global record for this year of £6,000 per sq ft.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Oil money is once again flowing through the arteries of Central London. This week it was revealed that a Middle Eastern buyer had bought a £28 million flat at One Hyde Park in Knightsbridge, setting a new global record for this year of £6,000 per sq ft.
Middle Eastern billionaires are snapping up swish properties as sales of lavish homes lift off Lucie Clayton's former house at Cornwall Gardens, Kensington Lucy Alexander and Claire Carponen
Recent market fluctuations have made Central London a very attractive prospect for wealthy international buyers . “The currency swings and fallen prices last year effectively created 50 per cent discounts for overseas purchasers,” says Stephan Miles-Brown, of Knight Frank, who adds that the price of “super-prime” London property has risen 20 per cent in a year. Dominic Grace, of Savills, says that super-prime sales in the first three months of 2010 have already exceeded the sales total for the whole of 2009.
But even oil billionaires don’t like to be fleeced. There must be better deals out there than £6,000 per sq ft. Try £3,600 per sq ft at Montpelier Hall, six new flats on Montpelier Street behind an 1896 red-brick gabled façade. It is closer to Harrods than One Hyde Park and the developer, Finchatton, has capitalised on the trend for modern interiors behind a period exterior so beloved by rich buyers.
Three “lateral” (on one floor — popular with buyers from spacious countries unused to vertiginous London houses) furnished flats, each about 3,850 sq ft, are for sale from £13.95 million to £14.5 million. The price scale relates to how much of the Brompton Oratory you can see from your 80ft living room and how much your neighbours can see of you on your terrace (a good deal, on the lowest floor).
Inside it resembles an expensive business hotel, with a good deal of plump upholstery. Bedrooms are extravagantly padded and mirrored, bathrooms are entombed in swirling marble and kitchens are minimalist to the point of surgical.
“This is for low-key people who don’t want to shout about their wealth,” says the agent, Philip Woolf (020-7935 8181, montpelierhall.co.uk). “There are no gold ceilings. The car lift is big enough for a Bentley but there’s no iris identification or electronic curtains. We had one guy look round who needed two parking spaces for his Lamborghinis. There was also a daughter of the ruling family of Dubai, who loved the idea of only having to carry her Harrods bags 100m from the store.”
For those prepared to strike out farther into SW7 and who don’t mind a front door on the busy Gloucester Road, a 9,000 sq ft house backing on to Cornwall Gardens is for sale at £16 million (£1,777 per sq ft). This building, divided into six smart flats, was once Lucie Clayton House, a sort of debutante factory where young ladies such as Joanna Lumley and Sandra Howard would go to be “finished”.
Farleys (020-7589 1234), the selling agent, believes that the house is likely to sell to a Middle Eastern buyer with an extended family and staff.
Lucie Clayton’s family sold the house in 2004 to Mickey Arora, a former director of Dow Jones newswires, who lives on the ground floor and lets the other flats (the weekly income if all six flats were let would be about £12,000). His tenants, all foreign, include “a CEO of a bank, a daughter of an oil baron and the son of a Saudi general”.
The building has many period features, good views from the roof terrace and a gate leading on to Cornwall Gardens. A buyer would want to get rid of a brown concrete bath akin to the penguin enclosure at London Zoo and an au pair’s room that Arora admits “is a bit of a dungeon”.
Oil barons prepared to slum it in East London can buy a luxury “suite” for as little as £1,200 per sq ft. Two of the eight penthouses at the Sugar House building on Leman Street (just outside the City’s Square Mile) have been bought by a Nigerian and a Hong Kong businessman. These Berkeley Homes flats lie behind an impressive Victorian façade of red brick, granite and Portland stone.
The best and biggest penthouse at the former headquarters of the Co-operative Wholesale Society is the Provenance suite. This three-bedroom duplex, on sale for £2.25 million, is 1,853 sq ft and has fine views. The white leather sofas, multi-room audio system and Italian kitchen are slick and modern, but it is the ornate ceiling plasterwork and domed roof light of the upstairs living/dining/kitchen area (formerly the old boardroom) that gives the penthouse its lavish look.
For international buyers, though, it might be the 20-minute walk to Liverpool Street station, the secure underground parking, 24-hour concierge and the video and phone entry system that they covet more.

item.title: A perfect finish for the Lucie Clayton School
item.dc:creator: will
item.excerpt:encoded: After its renovation, this former debs’ favourite is now flats for a very modern elite: A perfect finish for the Lucie Clayton School. By Renee Green.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Lucie Clayton School was once the place where debutants and well heeled girls went for classes in shorthand and typing alongside lesson in dinner-party planning and invitation etiquette. But after an extensive three-year restoration and refurbishment, its former grand South Kensington home at 4 Cornwall Gardens now hosts a new generation of equally refined residents.
The man responsible for developing the building, Mickey Arora, paid £2.5million for the house but has increased the building’s value more than three fold. The six one and two-bedroom apartments, let within weeks of the launch, cost from £1,200 to £2,000 a week.
“For these prices, you could rent a house but they appeal to certain individuals where style is the issue, not money” says Karen Kaldezar, Director of Faron Sutaria Lettings, 020 7590 0333

item.title: Lucie Clayton House: A model lesson in home-making
item.dc:creator: will
item.excerpt:encoded: Lucie Clayton House, once home to top debutantes, has now been converted into digi-tastic bachelor pads says Anna Tyzack

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
It has to be a sign of the times - Lucie Clayton's ladies etiquette school has been transformed into bachelor pads and dinky flats (dual income, no kids yet). Fine young ladies (Joanna Lumley was one of them) learnt the arts of flower-arranging, make-up, and catwalk modelling within the walls of 4 Cornwall Gardens in South Kensington, now six decadent furnished apartments. Debutantes were groomed for society in the gracious, sash-windowed rooms, attending lessons in deportment, dinner-party planning and invitation etiquette. These days, courses in multi-room audiovisual systems and remote-controlled Lutron lighting would need to be added to the curriculum - no expense has been spared in the renovation of the property. And since the apartments cost up to £2,000 a week to rent out, the residents will no longer aspire to marry a banker but will probably already be one.  
Class act - the vast living room in the show flat
  Lucie Clayton has been leaning more towards management than manners for a while. In the 1970s the school began to offer typing courses, although even those training to be secretaries had to learn some deportment (equivalent to half a term). Eventually Microsoft Office became more important to learn than modelling, and in 2003 Lucie Clayton School amalgamated with two secretarial colleges to form Quest Business Training, and moved to nearby Wetherby Gardens. "The school has changed with society," says Judith Kark, head of development at Quest, whose husband's family owned and ran Lucie Clayton. Make-up is the only original Lucie Clayton subject to be taught today, forming part of the "interview technique" syllabus. Lucie Clayton House - or 4 Cornwall Gardens - has also moved on but in many respects it has moved back. "It looks as it always should have done," says Kark, admiring the property for the first time since Lucie Clayton closed its doors. "It was always fighting to be an elegant set of rooms but at the time it had to be practical." The ballroom, with three long sash windows, where Lucie Clayton girls once learned to work the catwalk and manoeuvre themselves out of a car with grace, is now the drawing room of a one-bedroom flat. "It was where traditional Lucie Clayton grooming used to take place," says Kark. The kitchen, through a wide archway, is composed of simple block units and stone surfaces with pop-up sockets, in keeping with the minimalist design chosen by new owner Mickey Arora. "I've gone for classic, modern design because it's timeless. The tap is the only thing that sticks out - I just couldn't help that," he says. Meanwhile, at vast expense, he has restored the detailed cornicing, fireplace and arched doors. This attention to architectural details has been applied to the original cornicing, balustrades and front door to each apartment, and on the central staircase. The turning handrail winds up seven storeys and the banisters have been painted silver (there is also a funky aquamarine and chrome lift).   [caption id="attachment_1358" align="aligncenter" width="450"] Joanna Lumley was a pupil at Lucie Clayton's lesson in posture[/caption] "Although it looks very minimalist, the traditional features are all still there, telling you how the house was built and how it was meant to be," says Kark. Maintaining the building's natural sense of space and proportion has been Arora's main priority. "We haven't thought about finance all the time like developers; we've thought about what looks smart and stylish," he says. Interior designer Debbie Hatchwell used a warm paint palette, to contrast with the huge windows and neutral coloured furniture. The 6ft beds get swallowed up in vast bedrooms, with high ceilings - formerly typing or make-up classrooms. "The girls had to walk into a big room when practising interview techniques to make it seem more daunting," says Kark. There is one apartment on each floor, and they are all slightly different. A raised kitchen with brushed aluminium units on the second floor gives maximum space to the sitting room, while in the top-floor flat a staircase from the entrance hall leads to a summer kitchen and decked roof terrace, with 360-degree views across the Albert Memorial in Hyde Park and the Epsom Downs. The second-floor apartment also has a large terrace: "The girls weren't usually allowed out there," says Kark. "It was used for fire practices." The bathrooms have large, deep baths, triple-sized showers and LCD widescreen televisions. There are mirrors backed with silver leaf and bespoke sofas and carpets. The heated floors are made from double-layer acoustic boards and the electrical cables are hidden out of sight. This must be a good thing, as presumably there are quite a lot of wires accompanying the electric curtains, CCTV and audio-visual system with music server and iPod screens in each room. "I designed the audio-visual system myself - often they are too complicated and not suitable for apartments," says Arora. [caption id="attachment_1359" align="aligncenter" width="450"] The impressive bedroom in the show flat[/caption] Lucie Clayton House has taught Arora some important lessons about development. "I had difficulty finding good-quality workers - I had to have some jobs done three times. A lot of developers think it is good enough to use minimum specifications and charge maximum prices, so long as they install a gym," he says. "For me, it is a hobby - I love spending money on white elephants. I was very pedantic about restoring old features and hiding the electrics." The conversion has taken exactly three years - 18 months behind schedule but potential tenants are already circling, so Arora hopes it will prove a viable commercial investment. On each landing are pictures of Lucie Clayton pupils arranging flowers, or learning how to type, a poignant reminder of the building's past. "As practical rather than social skills became more important, we moved with the times," says Kark. Lucie Clayton House has also moved on: it is a debutante of a new school of residential investment, with rental apartments as poised and elegant as Lucie Clayton's top pupil. Arora is planning to use his newfound knowledge "on a bigger and better scale" somewhere else. Meanwhile, Lucie Clayton House can certainly teach other developers some manners, etiquette and presentation.
